She has been thinking about increasing her stock of beautiful plants, since she wants to capture a larger part of the market; that is, to be able to serve a higher demand. This has brought her to the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, buying a variety of ornamental plants. This will allow her to attract more customers and achieve her dream of improving her sales and income. This way, she will be able to access a better quality of life, bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ornamental plants.

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en:
Sahil is a 28-year-old man, who is married and has three children.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sahil has bred cattle and cows for the last three years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, he purchased his first cattle.

Sahil usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and this business is only one source of income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sahil also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

Sahil wants to expand his business and improve living conditions for his family. He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase one milking cow, two calves, and fodder.  This will be his fourth loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow, two calves, and fodder.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is from Panay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child. 

To make a living, Julie owns and operates a motor transport services business. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Julie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides de 33 años de edad, habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 42 años y un sobrino de 16 años el cual se encuentra estudiando. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de variedad de especies. Los cuales son productos alimenticios a base de vinagre, coliflor, repollo, remolacha, cebolla, entre otros, que el prepara con mucha paciencia para luego venderlos en tiendas y mercados. La venta de las especies las realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas del lugar donde vive. Tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y por el momento los resultados obtenidos han sido muy favorables ya que le han permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Él señor Alcides es muy trabajador y responsable muchas personas compran su producto ya que él ofrece calidad, higiene y buenos precios. Ha pensado mucho en cómo hacer crecer su negocio y ha llegado a la conclusión que lo mejor sería invirtiendo en la compra de los insumos necesarios al por mayor de tal forma que pueda aumentar su capacidad de venta y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda. Por lo tanto solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder llevar a cavo su idea de invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: zanahorias, vinagre, cebollas, coliflor, jalapeños, remolacha, repollo, etc. y de esta manera espera y confía en Dios y en su trabajo que logrará buenos resultados que le permitirán dar a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en: 33-year-old Alcides lives together with his family (his 42-year-old wife and a 16-year-old nephew who is in school).  His business is buying and selling a variety of spices.  He sells vinegar-based food products: cauliflower, cabbage, beets, onion, etc. which he prepares with a lot of patience and then sells in stores and markets.  He sells his spices as an itinerant vendor in different nearby areas.  He has been in this business for three years and his results have been very favorable as they have allowed him to provide his household with their daily bread.  Alcides is very hard-working and responsible.  Many people buy his products as he offers good quality, hygiene and good prices.  He has thought a lot about how to grow his business and has reached the conclusion that the best thing would be to invest in buying the supplies that he needs wholesale.  This will enable him to increase his sales capacity and deal with greater demand.  He is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL so that he can carry out his plan of investing in his business, buying the supplies he needs such as carrots, vinegar, onions, cauliflower, jalapeños, beets, cabbage, etc.  He trusts in God and believes that, through his work, he will obtain good results which will enable him to provide his family with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy carrots, vinegar, onions, cauliflower, jalapeños, beets, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Amina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for resale. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all attending school, has operated a business selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan for five years. Now requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for resale, she will use the resulting additional income to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos, a 45-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol, is a married man with three children. Marcos has been growing and selling rice for more than 10 years, arising early each morning to work on his land. He also has some workers who help till his land. Marcos earns 7000 PHP per month.

Now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor, Marcos hopes to earn more and save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married to Genson. They are blessed with five children. Margaret owns rental houses in the area of Kingstone Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Margaret is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy materials to build more rental houses. She will use the anticipated profit to educate and give her children a better life.

Margaret hopes to own more rental plots as well as have a family farm.

loans.use: To buy materials for building rental houses

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She makes rice cakes, pancakes, and other food items that she sells to her community. Margarita also started raising pigs to help augment her income. She had a small pigpen built in her backyard. Margarita works hard to support her family. She plans to use her loan to buy flour, sugar, piglets, and feed. Margarita hopes to succeed in her ventures.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, piglets, and feed

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo nació, en la provincia Quijarro de la ciudad de Potosí  Radica en la  localidad de  el torno,  es casado con la señora Irma por mas de doce año tiene cinco hijos que se encuentran estudiando,  viven en la casa de su suegra, el trabaja en la extracción de áridos en el rio pirai vendiendo  material de construcción a las distintas empresas constructoras y también  tiene su pequeña parcela que recién esta empezando a sembrar, su esposa trabaja en la venta de productos balanceados en el mercado de la zona todos los días. El cliente es antiguo ya que se encuentra pasando por la 14º secuencia, el crédito que esta solicitando es para el mantenimiento de su camioneta y comprar más mercadería para ampliar el negocio de su esposa. El se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución ya que siempre le han ayudado en  el momento mas preciso y nunca  se  les pone trabas, además es bastante rápido, eficiente.
texts.en: Wilfredo was born in Potosí, Quijarro Province. He lives in the town of Torno. He’s been married to his wife, Irma, for more than 12 years and they have 5 children who are currently studying. They live in his mother-in-law’s house. He works extracting gravel from the Pirai river to sell as construction material to all the different construction companies and he has a parcel of land that he’s starting to sow. His wife sells animal feed in the local market every day. Wilfredo is an old client and has been through 14 loan cycles. The loan he is requesting is for the maintenance of his truck and to buy more merchandise to expand his wife’s store. He’s very grateful to the institution since they’ve always helped him at just the right moment and never add obstacles and they’re quick and efficient.

loans.use: For the purchase of corn and soy for his wife's store and the maintenance of his truck.

loans.name: Dania Del Rosario

texts.es:
La profesora Dania se dedica a la docencia desde hace muchos años, experiencia que tiene en la enseñanza a los niños de primaria lo que le da gran satisfacción porque está aportando un granito de arena al desarrollo de nuestro país que tanto lo necesita.

Su familia está conformada por su esposo y tres hijos todos estudiando, son una familia luchadora y responsable en sus obligaciones y trabajo cualidad que le enseñan a sus hijos.

Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel han logrado mejorar un poco su vivienda, donde su objetivo consiste en acondicionarla para tener un buen ambiente para vivir con su familia.

En estos momentos su objetivo principal consiste en terminar de mejorar el local de su cocina con todas las condiciones por lo que está solicitando su tercer crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y azulejos para lograr su fin espera la ayuda de Ceprodel ya que en todo momento le ha estrechado su mano para continuar desarrollandose.
texts.en:
Dania is a teacher who has been teaching for many years.  She has experience teaching elementary school children.  Her job gives her a lot of satisfaction because she is contributing her grain of sand toward the development of our country which needs it so much.

Dania's family consists of her husband and three children who are all in school.  They are a hard-working family who are responsible in meeting their obligations and carrying out their work.  This is a quality that they teach their children.

Through the effort of her work and the loans that she has received from Ceprodel, Dania has managed to improve her house a little.  Her goal is to work on the house so that it has a good environment in which she can live together with her family.

Right now, Dania's main goal is to finish improving her kitchen.  She is requesting her third loan so that she can buy bricks, cement and tiles in order to achieve her goal.  She hopes to receive Ceprodel's help as they have always reached out their hand to help her continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and tiles

loans.name: Karina Juana

texts.es: La señora Karina tiene su  tienda de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad su tienda se encuentra en su propio domicilio que es la  casa  de sus papas,  su tienda tiene mucho tiempo de a poco fue creciendo y surtiendo de mercadería, ahora ya tiene una tienda surtida,   solo trabaja con la institución,  tiene 2 hijos menores  su esposo viaja mucho por cuestiones de trabajo y le manda dinero para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como dulces, refrescos galletas, etc. Para surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, ella es muy trabajadora y responsable por el momento hasta que se llegue su esposo se encarga sola de la educación de sus hijos, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Karina has a neighborhood store where she offers basic goods. Her store is in her house, which is owned by her parents. Her store started small and with time she has grown and accumulated merchandise, and now she has a stocked store.  She works with the institution alone. She has two young children and her husband travels a lot for work. He sends money to help with their household costs.

With the money from the loan she will buy merchandise like candies, sodas, cookies, etc to stock her store and be able to offer a variety of products to her customers. She is very hardworking and responsible and for the moment, until her husband arrives, she is solely in charge of her children's education. She is happy and thankful to the institution for the support they've given her.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages, and cookies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes se dedica a la confección  y comercialización de enaguas que usan las mujeres de pollera para ponerse debajo de su pollera,  la  venta la realiza en la populosa feria de la ciudad de El Alto,  también tiene dos talleres una se encuentra en la zona de la periférica y otro el en la zona de Alto Tacagua, donde trabaja y contrata mano de obra,  su esposo se dedica a otra actividad es contratista para distintas obras de construcción,  el crédito lo invertirá  para el aumento de su capital compra de telas y una cortadora y así de esta manera mejorar su trabajo ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar, ella es una persona muy trabajadora emprendedora con ganas de superación con el tiempo desea poder vender sus productos en la ciudad de Oruro y Cochabamba y así ampliar su mercado, s siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Lourdes works making and selling petticoats that women who wear "polleras" [traditional Andean skirts] wear under their skirts.  She makes her sales in the populous market in the city of El Alto.  She also has two workshops, one  in the area of the beltway and the other in the Alto Tacagua area, where she works and hires labor.  Her husband works in another job.  He is a contractor for different construction projects.

She will invest the loan in increasing her capital, purchasing fabric and a cutting machine.  This will improve her job because she has a lot of requests to deliver.

She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to improve her job.  She wants to be able to sell her products in the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba and so increase her market.  She feels grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 31 years old and married with three children. He builds houses and does welding to earn a living, and he has been in this business for four years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since Solomon joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business; he hopes to be financially stable in the future. Solomon has applied for 50,000 KES to buy cement and a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy cement and a welding machine.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has sold charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for five years.

Asunta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hamad, and he works as a teacher. 

Ramla operates a retail shop. She's worked in this business for three years, and her primary customers are her neighbors and friends. She describes seasonality as her greatest business challenge, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ramla will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for sale. Ramla aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO DE UMUTO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Lorenza; la socia tiene 33 años de edad; ella es casada, la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su tienda con la compra de harinas, leche, fideos, azúcar, arroz y otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche entre otros productos.
La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en: Lorenza belongs to the communal bank "El Progresso" which is located three hours from the city of Cusco, in the district of Quispicanchis and the Ocongate province in the department of Cusco.  She is 33 years old and married.  She runs a grocery store and wants to stock her store with flour, milk, noodles, sugar, rice and other products.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other products.  She is grateful for the loan opportunity which will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk and other products.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito, ya que quiere comprarse dos vaquillas y concentrado para alimentarlas, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar el ganado en su terreno, creciendo y mejorando su condición ganadera.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar, teniendo más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lucio has decided to apply for a new loan, as he wishes to buy two heifers and concentrated feed. This purchase will help him to add to the cattle on his land, expanding and improving his livestock. 

He considers that the previous loan helped him improve, by enabling him to have more work opportunities.

loans.use: To buy two heifers and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Marggi

texts.es: Con su anterir  credikiva Marggi compró implementos de panadería, refrescos y dulcería, contrató unpanadero e inició su proceso promocional, inicialmente le fue muy bien, porque logró un contrato con los hogares sustituos del estado y sus utilidades se incrementaron.Como el panadero no cumplió con su trabajo, en la actualidad está comprando los productos de panadería, porque responderá al buen contrato que tiene. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará panes en un importante volumen para seguir como proveedora de estos hogares porque con ellos le va muy bien y esto se lo debe a su credikiva. En la actualidad su volumen de compras es alto y está muy satisfecha con la inversión permanente en panes, huevos, dulcería entre otros alimentos y articulos de aseo que vende en su punto comercial.
texts.en:
Marggi used her previous loan to buy bakery supplies, soft drinks and sweet treats.  She hired a baker and started a marketing campaign.  At first, things went very well because she got a contract with the children's homes in her state and her profits increased.  However, as her baker didn't manage to carry out his work, she is now buying bakery products so that she can respond to the good contract that she has.  This is why she is applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy bread in large volumes so that she can continue as the supplier of these homes because her business with them is going very well and this is due to her Kiva loan.  

Right now, Marggi buys goods wholesale and she is very satisfied with her permanent investment in bread, eggs, sweet treats and also other food products and cleaning products that she sells from her sales premises.

loans.use: to buy bread in large volumes, eggs, sweet treats, other food products and cleaning products

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena es una emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo emprendió su negocio de la venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos, café esta emprendedora su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y también en su casa de habitación atiende a sus clientes, ella recorre los mercados de la localidad para ofrecer su producto. Martha Lorena ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, lo cual es una emprendedora que es muy responsable y con deseos de superación cada día con su negocio y en lo personal. Martha Lorena está solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para comprar más producto para el negocio lo cual comprara café, maíz, cal, frijoles para brindarle a sus clientes.
texts.en: Martha Lorena is an entrepreneur who worked hard to set up a business selling tortillas, baked beans and coffee.  This entrepreneur carries out her business as an itinerant vendor and also serves her customers from her home.  She travels around the markets in her town to offer her products for sale.  Martha Lorena has already received loans from Fundación León 2000.  She is a very responsible entrepreneur who has a desire to continue making progress in both her business and her personal life.  Martha Lorena is requesting a new loan to buy more products for her business.  She will buy coffee, corn, lime and beans to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy coffee, corn, lime and beans

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman with one child. She is 65 years old and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. Rufina owns and operates a farm, planting, harvesting, and selling bananas to earn a living. She's been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Rufina requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchased fertilizers, such as manure. Rufina has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and married with one child. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for six years and employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has been able to save his income, and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, actualmente vive en casa propia que ha logrado construir con mucho esfuerzo junto su esposa y a sus 3 hijos de quienes él es el responsable del sustento familiar, el lugar donde vive Oscar es una comunidad pequeña de nombre “Mochumí” es una zona rural de unas 100 familias residentes aproximadamente, el cual es un distrito de Provincia de Chiclayo y Departamento de Lambayeque y se encuentra a 1 hora aproximadamente.

Oscar tiene como actividad económica la venta de repuestos de bicicletas y motocicletas en un espacio instalado en su propio domicilio, actividad a la que se dedica ya un aproximado de 3 años, según nos comenta Oscar la idea de iniciar mencionado negocio nació de una conversación con su esposa, y es que siempre han estado pendientes de cómo salir adelante y mejorar la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Por ser una zona rural donde vive Oscar los requerimientos de repuestos para motocicletas son continuos.

Lo que Oscar Invirtió resulta poco para la demanda que tiene en la actualidad por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles, que será utilizado en la compra repuestos y otros accesorios de suma importancia para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así puedan laborar mejor en sus vehículos

Oscar se ha ganado el cariño y el respeto de sus vecinos de quienes cuenta con buenas referencias tanto él como su familia, respeto que se han ganado por su buen carácter y sus buenos valores que transmiten.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hard-working and very responsible man.  He currently lives in his own home which he worked very hard to build.  He lives with his wife and three children, and he is responsible for supporting the family.  Oscar lives in a small community called "Mochumi".  It is a rural place which is home to approximately 100 families and is located in Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque department.

Oscar's business is selling bicycle and motorcycle parts.  He makes his sales from a space that he has set up in his own home and he has been in his business for approximately three years.  Oscar tells us that the idea to set up this business came about during a conversation with his wife.  They have always been alert as to how they can get ahead and improve their children's education and food.  As Oscar lives in a rural area, the need for motorcycle parts is continuous.

The amount that Oscar invested in his business was not enough to deal with the demand that he is currently experiencing.  For this reason, he has decided to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the money to buy spare parts and other very important accessories that he needs to satisfy his customers so that they can work better in their vehicles.

Oscar has gained the affection and respect of his neighbors who provide good references both for him and his family.  He has gained this respect through his good nature and his good values.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of spare parts to stock his business

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is applying for another loan to start a motorcycle transportation business, known locally as a boda boda. He will use this 80,000 KES loan to purchase a motorcycle. In the future, Saidi aspires to continue improving his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Saidi has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his new transport business.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 41 years old and supports her four children, aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years. She is in the taxi business. She started her business five years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Rael has applied for a third loan of 60,000 KES to service her car. The anticipated profit would aid in repaying her loan. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to service her car.

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Gloria compró útiles escolares, papelería, uniformes y calzado y le fue muy bien. Hoy en esta misma época invertirá en útiles escolares y mercancía variada alusiva al carnaval de Barranquilla que está muy cerca y que trae consigo nuevas ganancias, si se invierte en lo que la temporada exige.  “Mis agradecimientos a la ayuda que esta entidad, FMSD, me ha prestado durante 15 años,  ello ha sido uno de los pilares fundamentales para el crecimiento de mi negocio. Que sigan apoyando a más personas.”
texts.en:
With her previous credikiva, Gloria bought school supplies, uniforms, and shoes; and it went very well. Today, and at the same time of year, she will buy school supplies, and a variety of merchandise related to the Barranquilla carnival. The carnival is very near, and brings with it new earnings, if one invests in what the season demands. 

"My thanks for the help that this insititution, FMSD, has provided me for 15 years. This has been one of the main supports for the growth of my business. May they keep supporting more people."

loans.use: To buy school supplies, and a variety of merchandise related to the Barranquilla carnival.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 32 years old and married with three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de Bok Jom a été crée le 21/12/2009. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Maimouna est la responsable du groupe elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est âgée de 36 ans et a en charge aussi sa belle mère.

Elle développe un petit commerce de d'habits, de chaussures et de sacs à main pour dames

Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des habits pour tout sexe et chaussures qu'elle revend dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. D'assurer une bonne alimentation à sa famille.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom solidarity group was set up on 21 December 2009. It is made up of ten women, who all come from the same area. Their main acitivity is retail.

Standing on the right of the photo is Maimouna, who is  the group leader. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also cares for her mother-in-law.

Maimouna is building up a small business selling clothing, shoes and handbags for women.

With her loan she will buy men and women's clothing and shoes, which she will resell in her neighbourhood.

She will use the income from this to meet her family's needs and ensure they all eat well.

loans.use: clothing, shoes and bags

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 28-year-old man who is married with one child. He sells food products as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar, and beverages in his shop.  He has three years of experience in this field, in which he is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

Asif would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional foodstuffs. This will be his fifth loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy additional food products

loans.name: Edilberto Wiles

texts.es:
Edilberto es un hombre de 61 años que desde hace 14 años se dedica a laborar como agricultor, él siempre se ha dedicado siempre al cultivo del algodón, fue su padre quien le enseño este oficio y fue el mismo quien le dejo el terreno y algunos cultivos ya hechos, a lo largo de todos estos años, Edilberto ha aprendido a amar a los que se dedica es por eso que siempre está al pendiente de su siembra y se siente muy feliz de laborar en este tipo de negocio.

Edilberto vive en el campo junto a su esposa, ellos tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, ambos son personas muy humildes y corteses, siempre están al pendiente de atender muy bien a sus visitantes sólo porque les nace hacerlos sentir como en casa.

Este hombre de cultivo desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan apoyarlo y así el pueda realizar la compra de algunos pesticidas y plaguicidas necesarios para su negocio debido a que en el transcurso de estos meses desea realizar una nueva siembra debido a que el algodón siempre tarda en poder crecer.
Edilberto desea poder brindarle a su esposa todas las comodidades que ella necesita y sabe que esto lo logrará con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, vendiendo muy bien su cultivo. También desea poder continuar con este negocio toda su vida y que sus hijos aprendan del mismos y también sus nietos, con la finalidad de que no solo atraviese por generación y generación si no que se convierta en una empresa muy reconocida y logren todos los sueños y metas que se tracen.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a 61-year-old man who has been working as a farmer for 14 years.  He has always grown cotton and it was his father who taught him this business.  His father also left him his land with some crops already planted.  Over the years, Edilberto has learned to love what he does.  For this reason, he is always taking care of his crops and feels very happy working in this type of business.

Edilberto lives in the countryside together with his wife.  They have two children who are already married.  They are both very modest and polite people who always treat their visitors very well because they were born to make them feel at home.

This farmer would like Kiva lenders to support him so that he can buy some pesticides that he needs for his business.  Over the next few months, he would like to sow some new crops because cotton always takes a while to grow.  Edilberto would like to provide his wife with all the comforts that she needs and he knows that he will achieve this with a lot of hard work and commitment, selling his crops well.  He would like to be able to continue in this business his whole life and would like his children and grandchildren to learn the business too so that not only will it pass down from generation to generation but it will also become a very well-known business and they will fulfill all the dreams and goals that they set themselves.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his cotton crop

loans.name: Zulfuqar

texts.en:
Zulfuqar is a 38-year-old man and married with two children. He sells mobile phones and phone accessories. He has five years of experience in this field and has gained the skills and experience necessary to be a successful entrepreneur. 

He has learned both market prices and his customers' needs very well. Hence, he usually buys merchandise for lower prices than his competitors and resells it more profitably. Mobile phones and accessories are in high demand because people in Azerbaijan like to have two or more mobile phones, which helps to separate their personal lives from their work. Zulfuqar's monthly income is 350 AZN.

Zulfuqar would like to expand his business, and for this purpose he has applied for 1500 AZN. He wishes to increase his sales and improve the living conditions of his family. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest CU, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela de 45 años de edad, habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, etc. Tiene aproximadamente 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y gracias a Dios todo poderoso, su trabajo y dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo activo y se caracteriza por ser una de las mejores modistas de la zona ya que con la experiencia se ha hecho experta en la confección de prendas de vestir. La elaboración y venta de las prendas de vestir las realiza en su hogar de residencia lugar que es muy concurrido ya que se encuentra en la zona céntrica del lugar donde habita. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materia prima (telas, hilos, tijeras, elásticos, etc.) ya que su sueño es abarcar una mayor demanda de mercado para lograr mejorar su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos que le permitan seguir dando a su familia un soporte económico y junto a su esposo brindar mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela, 45, lives with her family group, made up of her husband and two children.  She works making and selling a variety of articles of clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, etc.

She has been doing this work for approximately 20 years and, thanks to Almighty God, her work, and her dedication, she has managed to keep the business going.  She is known as being one of the best fashion designers in the area because with her experiences she has become expert in making clothing.  She makes and sells the clothes in her home, a place that is very busy because it is in the central area of the place she lives.

She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business by purchasing raw materials (fabric, thread, scissors, elastic, etc.).

Her dream is to cover a greater market demand to improve her level of sales as well as her income.  This will allow her to continue giving her family financial support and, with her husband, offer them better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, scissors, elastic, etc.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia de 53 años de edad,  habita en casa de su propiedad junto  con su esposo de 60 años de edad y su hija la cual ya es mayor de edad. La señora María  se dedica a la  venta de diferentes productos tales como: lácteos, bebidas, pollos y ropa usada, etc.   Como toda mujer emprendedora ha hecho de su casa un negocio,  tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad.   Cada día los clientes la prefieren mas  por ser una mujer dedicada en su trabajo, ofrecer buenos precios, calidad y por siempre satisfacer las necesidades de estos.  Siempre trata de estar al día con los productos de tal forma que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. La señora María  tiene muchos sueños y uno de ellos es ver su negocio florecer. Todo esto la ha impulsado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la esperanza de que de esta manera va mejorar su situación y lograra alcanzar su sueño. El crédito lo quiere para invertirlo en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: leche, bebidas, pollos y ropa usada, etc. Que le permitan a traer a mas clientes y poder así accesar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 53, and lives in her own home with her husband, who is 60, and her adult daughter. Maria sells various goods such as dairy products, drinks, chickens, and used clothing. As with every enterprising woman, she has made her home into a business, and has worked in this occupation for many years. 

Her customers prefer her more each day, because she is a woman devoted to her work, to offering good prices and quality, and to always satisfying customer needs. She always tries to be up-to-date with products, so that customers always find what they are looking for.

Maria has many dreams, and one of them is to see her business flourish. All this has motivated her to make the decision to apply to Integral for this loan, hoping that in this way, she will improve her situation, and succeed in realizing her dream. 

She wants the loan in order to buy the supplies she needs; such as milk, drinks, chickens, and used clothing.  This will allow her to attract more customers, and in this way, gain access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy milk, drinks, chickens and used clothing.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis s un joven de 28 años el cual cada día le pone mucho esfuerzo para salir adelante, el vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago,caracterizada por su clima cálido, por su agricultura en especial la siembre de algodón , esparrago, uvas, los cuales actualmente se exportan a los diversos países del mundo, así como también por la generosidad de sus pobladores; como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es la riquísima “carapulcra con sopa seca”, Jose Luis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica Automotriz. Jose Luis es conviviente y junto a su pareja tienen 2 pequeños hijos de 8 y 4 años a los cuales el adora mucho y son su razón de vivir.

Jose Luis conduce una mototaxi, en la cual brinda servicio de transporte a los pobladores de la ciudad, dicha mototaxi es alquilada por ello el se levanta muy temprano para poder aprovechar todo el día, ya que tiene que devolver el vehículo a determinada hora, trabaja alrededor de 11 horas diarias, pero los días domingos trabaja todo el día ya que la persona que le alquila la mototaxi le ha brindado esa facilidad y por ello el aprovecha para tener un dinerito extra, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le pone mucho empeño al realizar su trabajo y es responsable, honesto y sobre todo consciente de que al prestar su servicio lleva vidas en el vehículo y por ello tiene que trabajar lo mejor posible.

Jose Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprarse una mototaxi, con ello ya no tendrá que pagar alquiler y podrá tener más ingresos, con ello mejorara su calidad de vida y sobre todo seguirá ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Jose Luis, 28, is a young man who puts a lot of effort into getting ahead every day. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago. This city is known for its warm climate and agriculture, especially crops like cotton, asparagus and grapes, all of which are exported to different countries around the world by the generosity of those inhabitants. Like all good Peruvians, he loves food and his favorite dish is “carapulcra con sopa seca” (a dish of dried potatoes with meat and sauce with a side of pasta and vegetable soup). Jose couldn’t study a professional career, but he would have liked to study auto mechanics. Jose lives with his partner and they have 2 children, 8 and 4 years old. He adores them as they are his reason to live.

Jose drives a mototaxi and provides transportation to the people of the city. He rents the mototaxi and gets up early in the morning to take advantage of the whole day since he has to return the vehicle at a determined hour. He works about 11 hours a day, but he also works all day on Sunday because the owner of the mototaxi offered it to him. Jose takes advantage of it to make a little extra cash. He thinks his business is going well because he’s determined to work, he’s responsible, honest, and above all, aware that the service he provides puts people’s lives in his hands and he has to do the best job he can.

Jose Luis is very grateful for the loan from Kiva. Thanks to their support, he will be able to buy his own mototaxi, and not have to rent one. He’ll also make more money and improve his quality of life. And, above all else, he’ll continue saving money to realize his big dream: to finish building his house.

loans.use: buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: Rebeca Del Socorro es una de las emprendedoras que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la comprar mercadería en general en lo cual durante l crédito ella mostro ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores. La emprendedora nos expresa que con el financiamiento que se le otorgo aumento mucho su mercadería y de igual manera sus clientes que la visitan y que ella misma los visita. Esta emprendedora actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ropa, blusas, pantalones, camisas, cosméticos entre otros productos que son buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Rebeca Del Socorro is an entrepreneur who has used a loan to invest in her business, purchasing general merchandise.  Over the course of her previous loan she showed herself to be a responsible person with good values.  This entrepreneur tells us that she used the loan she received to greatly increase her merchandise.  The number of customers that visit her and the number of customers that she visits herself also increased.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy clothes (blouses, pants, shirts), cosmetics and other products that her customers are looking for.

loans.use: to buy clothes (blouses, pants, shirts), cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa de 20 años está casada con Fermín con quien tiene 1 hijo, Ángel de 4 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el barrio de San Carlos en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Jesusa es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora. A su corta edad como madre ha visto muchas maneras de cómo ganarse la vida. Es así, que inició vendiendo bebidas frías y heladas de frutas nativas de la selva. 
Por su parte, Fermín trabaja en un aserradero fabricando cajones de madera y ella le lleva sus alimentos todos los días. Es una familia muy unida. Pero no descuidan sus cultivos. Hace 3 años que se dedican a la agricultura con las siembras de café. Cuando dispone de tiempo, mayormente en los fines de semanas se dirige a sus chacras para limpiarlas o abonarlas.
Jesusa tiene un hijo pequeño y por él espera lograr sus metas, que son cultivar en mayores cantidades por que la venta de café en los meses de marzo hasta abril es muy buena. Sería la primera vez que Jesusa obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en pospagos mensuales. Al mismo tiempo resalta que será participativa y responsable dentro de las actividades con su banco comunal “San Carlos". Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos para su cafetal. Con lo sobrante podrá comprar ladrillos y calaminas para arreglar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
20-year-old Jesusa is married to Fermín and the couple have one son: 4-year-old Ángel.  This family live in their own home in San Carlos neighborhood, in Chahchamayo province.  Jesusa is a keen and hard-working young woman.  At her young age, as a mother, she has seen many ways of making a living.  She decided to start selling cold and chilled drinks made from native rainforest fruits. 

Fermín works in a sawmill, making wooden crates, and Jesusa takes him his meals every day.  They are a very united family.  However, they do not neglect their crops.  They have been growing coffee for three years.  When she has time, mainly on the weekend, Jesusa heads to her farm to weed or fertilize her crops.

Jesusa has a young son and, for his sake, she hopes to achieve her goal which is to grow her crops in larger quantities because coffee sells very well during the months of March and April.  This will be the first time that Jesusa has received a loan from MFP.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  She stresses that she will take part in the activities led by her community bank (called 'San Carlos') and be responsible.  Jesusa will invest her money in buying bags of fertilizer for her coffee crops.  She will use any remaining money to buy bricks and sheets of corrugated metal with which to fix her roof.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer as well as bricks and sheets of corrugated metal

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban is a 55-year-old man and married with four children. He is a professional butcher and has been selling mutton and beef for ten years. His shop is located in the central streets of his home town.

Meat is in very high demand throughout the year in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Qurban`s profit is 120 AZN per month, and he wishes to increase his monthly turnover. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to buy more meat to meet his customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and the mother of two children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has been able to grow her business, and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 KES to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He is 49 years old and blessed with four children, aged 17, 14, 11, and eight years old. John owns a retail shop, and he has been in operation for three years, earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

He is requesting a second loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, after he successfully repaid the previous loan. He intends to use this amount to purchase more stock for his business.  

The anticipated profits from the loan will be used to educate his school-aged children. John hopes to grow his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sweets, and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Rosa De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 45 años, tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida. Empezó cuando trabajaba con su amiga que vive cerca de su domicilio, su trabajo lo hace con una vecina del sector su horario es de 10:00 hasta las 19:00, sus dificultades son la delincuencia, está divorciada, tiene una hija de 16 años que estudia en escuela fiscal. 

Su sueño es tener su propio local de comida rápidas y también realizar mejoras a su domicilio. El prestamo lo quiere para comprar verdes, arroz, pescados y asi poder hacer mas comida para venderla a sus clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 and hopes to grow her food sales business in coming years.  She began working with a friend who lives nearby, and she now works from 10:00 until 19:00.   The main challenge she faces is dealing with crime.  She is divorced, and has a daughter who is 16 and studies in a fiscal school. 
Rosa's dream is to have her own shop to sell food and to make improvements to her home.  She wants to use this credit to buy greens, rice, fish and thus to prepare more food for her regular customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, fish and greens

loans.name: Nimia Domitila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nidia Domitila; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de calzados y también tiene una tienda donde alquila disfrazes, el negocio de venta de calzados lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor y también para comprar disfraces.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Atipay Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Nimia Domitila, is 38 years old and married, with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling footwear.  She also has a store where she rents dress clothes.  She conducts her business selling footwear as a street vendor.  With these small businesses she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the shoes.

The member is requesting the loan to buy shoes wholesale and also to buy dress clothes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale and to buy dress clothes.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De La F Group

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta  es conviviente,  tiene 49 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Las Emprendedoras de la F”  grupo  conformado por  6  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Vicenta   se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde  hace 7 años, Vicenta empezó vendiendo verduras en una carreta en las calles, con el tiempo pudo ahorrar dinero, y puso una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes, dulces, verduras, gaseosas y a su vez también alquila su casa, Vicenta inicio este negocio con la idea de ofrecerle una estabilidad a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos van a la escuela  , se ha comprado un terreno, Vicenta  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar útiles escolares , cuadernos, mochila, lapiceros, borrador y empezar a venderlos por temporada escolar  . Vicenta  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Vicenta  lives with her partner.  She is 49 years old and has four children.  She is currently a member of "Las Emprendedoras de la F" community bank.  This bank has 6 members who work in different business activities.  Vicenta's business is selling groceries.  She has been in this line of work for 7 years.  She started out selling vegetables from a cart in the streets and then, over time, she was able to save some money and set up a grocery store in her home where she sells groceries, sweet treats, vegetables and soda.  At the same time, she also rents out part of her home.  Vicenta started this business with the aim of providing her family with stability.  Thanks to her hard work and commitment, she has managed to make better income, her children go to school and she has bought a plot of land.  Vicenta has requested a new loan to buy school supplies.  She will buy composition books, backpacks, pencil sharpeners and erasers, and start selling them during the back-to-school period.  Vicenta will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort.  Edaprospo's loans with help her.

loans.use: to buy school supplies (composition books, backpacks, pencil sharpeners, erasers, etc.)

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel de 29 años, es un hombre casado. Yolanda, su esposa y Estefany, su hija de 3 años, son su mayor tesoro. Él vive con su familia en una casa propia en el anexo de Yanapuquio, en el distrito de Palcamayo, provincia de Tarma. Fidel es un hombre trabajador. En sus 10 años como agricultor ya sabe que es lo que el conviene. “Siembro papas Yungay, Andina y Jilgero, por que su demanda no cesa”, menciona.
Sus terrenos de cultivos se ubican en 2 distritos. En Palcamayo tiene parcelas en 5 partes distintas; y en Palca cuenta con 5 lotes. Por la distancia de sus terrenos tiene que estar ausente de su hogar casi todo el día y tiene que distribuir su tiempo de tal manera que toda su producción bote los frutos esperados.
Sí, su necesidad de contratar operarios es urgente, pagando a 25 soles al día por cada uno. 
Sus cosechas son vendidas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cada saco de papas cuesta 35 soles en promedio. Pero teniendo en cuenta que sus cosechas ascienden a los 800 sacos al año, sus ingresos son considerables. 
Gracias a lo bien que le va, piensa adquirir otro terreno para producir otras variedades del tubérculo. Sería el crédito número 14 que obtendría de MFP, por ende se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Zona Semillera de Yanapuquio”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente contento y complacido por los resultados obtenidos. Invertirá el dinero de su préstamo en la compra de bolsas de guano de corral; además pagará el servicio de operarios que contratará para voltear y cultivar sus plantaciones de papas.
texts.en:
29-year-old Fidel is a married man.  Yolanda, his wife, and his 3-year-old daughter Estefany are his biggest treasures.  He lives together with his family in his own home, in the small village of Yanapuquio, in Palcamayo district, Tarma province.  Fidel is a hard-working man.  He has worked as a farmer for 10 years and knows that it is for him.  "I grow Yungay, Andina and Jilgero potatoes because there is a constant demand for them", he says.

Fidel's plots of farmland are located over two districts.  In Palcamayo he has plots in 5 different places and in Palca he has 5 lots.  Owing to the distance between his plots of land, he has to be away from home almost all day long and he has to divide his time in such a way that all his crops bear the expected fruits.

Fidel's need to hire laborers is urgent.  He pays his laborers 25 soles a day each.

Fidel sells his harvests in the wholesale market in Tarma.  Each sack of potatoes costs an average of 35 soles.  However, bearing in mind that his harvests reach 800 sacks a year, his income is sizable.

Thanks to how well his business is going, Fidel is planning to acquire a new plot of land so that he can produce other varieties of potato.  This will be his 14th loan from MFP and he pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  "Zona Semillera de Yanapuquio" is the name of his community bank.  He feels happy and pleased with the results he has obtained.  He will invest his loan money in buying bags of bird guano.  He will also pay the laborers who he will hire to turn his soil and grow his potatoes.

loans.use: to buy bags of bird guano and to hire laborers

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, actualmente vive en casa de su madre junto su esposa y a su pequeña hija de quienes él es el responsable del sustento familiar, el lugar donde vive Mario es una comunidad pequeña de nombre “Morrope” es una zona rural de unas 100 familias residentes aproximadamente, el cual es un distrito de Provincia de Chiclayo y Departamento de Lambayeque y se encuentra a 2 horas aproximadamente.

Mario se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de abarrotes en un espacio instalado en su propio domicilio, actividad a la que se dedica ya un aproximado de 2 años, según nos comenta, aprendió a los negocios desde muy pequeño y con quien siempre ha trabajado ha sido con su madre quien se ha dedicado a los negocios siempre, y es que con el afán de siempre salir adelante decidió llevar el negocio él, debido a su disponibilidad y a que es un trabajo pesado para su madre, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y su madre cada vez que el sale en busca de sus clientes a realizar sus compra.

Lo que Mario Invirtió resulta poco para la demanda que tiene en la actualidad por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles, que será utilizado en la compra abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir aun más su negocio el cual con el tiempo crecerá, y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez podrá cumplir su objetivo de darle una buena educación a su menor hija.

Mario se ha ganado el cariño y el respeto de sus vecinos de quienes cuenta con buenas referencias tanto él como su madre y demás familiares, respeto que se han ganado por su buen carácter y sus buenos valores que transmiten.
texts.en:
Mario is a responsible, hard-working young man. He lives in his mother’s house with his wife and little daughter. He is responsible for the financial support of the family. He lives in the small community of Morrope, a rural area with about 100 resident families, which is a district of the province of Chiclayo and is about 2 hours from the department of Lambayeque.

Mario works exclusively in grocery sales for two years now, in a space installed in his own house. He learned about the business at a very young age as he always worked with his mother, who has always carried the business. With the intention of getting ahead, he took over the business because he had the time and it was getting to be too much for his mother. Now, his wife and mother step in when he goes out to buy inventory.

Mario’s investment wasn’t enough to satisfy the demands of his clients, currently, so he’s decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of $750 (2000 PEN). It will be used to buy groceries and other everyday staples in order to stock up his store, which will grow in time and help him improve his quality of life and at the same time realize his dream of affording his daughter a good education.

Mario has won the affection and respect of his neighbors, who give him, his mother and their family good references. They are respected for their good character and the good values they transmit.

loans.use: buy groceries and other everday staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room at the bottom of her yard

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling drugs in Kator South Sudan for six years.

Sarah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase drugs. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to sell.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él es comerciante de granos básicos y vende pan de manera ambulante, este negocio es de familia, porque casi todos sus hermanos están en esta actividad, inicia su labor muy temprano para obtener el pan de la panadería y finaliza como a las 8:00pm, su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio de los granos básicos.
Actualmente José está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frijoles, maíz, arroz, café, para aumentar la disponibilidad en el negocio, así podrá ofrecer a los clientes para continuar en sus ventas.
La aspiración de él es mejorar el negocio con la ayuda de los préstamos y tambien que a través de las ventas tener la capacidad para pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and one child. His business is selling basic grains and he is a mobile street vendor who sells bread. This is a family business, as all of his siblings are in the same line of work. He starts work early in the morning to get the bread from the bakery and finishes around 8pm. His wife takes care of the selling of basic grains.
Jose is requesting a loan to buy beans, corn, rice and coffee to increase his offerings in his business in order to continue his sales.
He aspires to improve his business with the help of the loan and that his sales will enable him to pay his installments.

loans.use: buy beans, corn, rice and coffee.

loans.name: Tomasa Nidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa Nidia; ella tiene 63 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel inicial, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar arroz, azúcar y leche al por mayor para mantención de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Atipay Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Tomasa Nidia, is 63 years old and single, and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her job as a pre-school teacher.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.  With this job she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a grocery store business.

The member is requesting the loan for personal use, to buy rice, sugar, and milk wholesale to suport her house.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and milk wholesale to support her house.

loans.name: Nieves Yaqueline

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves Yaqueline; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una empresa pública, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio propio de venta de calzados. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “ATIPAY”. The bank is in the district of Cusco, both part of the province and department of Cusco.

The associate is Nieves Yaqueline. She is a 37-year-old married mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with work in a public company; she works from 8am to 7pm and with this job she can get ahead with her family. Her dream is to own a shoe store. She is requesting this loan for personal use to buy a TV for her home.

The associate is very happy for this loan and promises to meet the payments of her loan.

loans.use: buy a TV for her home.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa Isabel su actividad económica a la que es la venta de mercadería en general, el préstamo que solicito era para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de producto. Rosa es una emprendedora que cada día lucha para sacar a sus hijos adelantes y nos cuenta que el negocio esta prosperando cada día, ya que sus clientes la buscan por la variedad de producto que ofrece. Rosa Isabel actualmente está solicitando para comprar más mercadería como ropa, camisas, ropa interior, ropa de vestir entre otros productos.
texts.en: Rosa Isabel's business is selling general merchandise.  She requested her previous loan to invest in her business, buying a variety of products.  Rosa is an entrepreneur who works hard every day to provide for her children and she tells us that her business is doing well as her customers seek her out because of the variety of products that she offers.  Rosa Isabel is currently requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as clothes, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Rojas

texts.es:
Rojas de 46 años convive con Julia, la madre de sus 6 hijos. El mayor de ellos tiene 21 años y el menor 10. Esta numerosa familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Rojas se dedica a la agricultura desde niño. Él nació y creció rodeado de las montañas y frutos, dentro de su propia localidad, es por eso que ahora, sabe lo suficiente para sembrar café, cacao, plátanos y maíz. En sus 3 parcelas de terrenos produce café y cacao en su mayoría por que son los productos más solicitados en su zona.
Cada vez que cosecha debe invertir en el pago de personal, ya que el trabajo de limpieza absorbe demasiado tiempo y esfuerzo.
“Este año el precio del cacao bajó a 4 soles por kilo, pero aun así ganamos. Cuando bajan los precios siempre recuperamos la inversión aunque no se gane mucho”, afirma.
Toda su producción la ofrece en el mercado mayorista de Pichanaki, y para su traslado también invierte. Los gastos en el campo son muchos, pero las recompensas son buenas si se sabe trabajar. Ésta sería la segunda vez que Rojas accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar”, y se siente a gusto de formar parte del grupo. Destinará el dinero del crédito en el pago del personal operario a quien contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rojas is 46 years old and lives with Julia, the mother of his six children.  His eldest child is 21 and his youngest is 10.  This large family live together in their own home in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Rojas has been farming since he was a boy.  He was born and grew up surrounded by mountains and fruit.  For this reason, he now knows enough to grow coffee, cacao, bananas and corn.  On his three plots of farmland, he grows mainly coffee and cacao as they are the products which are most in demand in his area.

Every time that he harvests his crops, Rojas must invest in paying laborers as the weeding work takes a lot of time and effort.

"This year the price of cacao fell to 4 soles a kilo but we still make a profit. When the prices fall we always recover our investment even if we don't earn much profit," he says.

Rojas sells all of his crops in the wholesale market in Pichanaki and he must also invest in transporting his crops.  His farming expenses are high but the rewards are good if you know how to work.  This will be the second time that Rojas takes out a loan from MFP.  He pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments.  He is a member of "Los Kontonas de Palomar" community bank and he enjoys being a member of the group.  He will use his loan money to pay laborers who he must hire in order to weed his crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ligia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como supervisora de una empresa de telefonía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para su casa.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Atipay" communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
This is Mrs. Ligia. She is 48 and married. She shares her daily chores with her job as a supervisor in a telecommunications company. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She wants to get ahead through this work. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of furniture for her home.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay off her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Carmen Maya

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Maya; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de calzados y también vende productos naturales para la salud, ella vende en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar calzados y productos naturales al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Atipay" communal bank, located in Cuzco district, which is part of Cusco province and department. The borrower's name is Carmen Maya. She is 37 and single. 

She alternates her daily activities with her business selling shoes. She also sells natural health products. She sells independently, and wants to get ahead by means of these businesses. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy shoes and natural products at wholesale. She is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy shoes and natural products at wholesale.

loans.name: Karolay Denisse

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karolay Denisse; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de realizar encuestas, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta a las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere ahorrar y terminar de estudiar. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de la universidad.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "ATIPAY" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The member is Karolay Denisse.  She is 20 years old and single.  The member divides her time between her daily activities and her work doing surveys.  She works from 7.00am to 6.00pm and, through her work, she would like to be able to save up and finish her studies.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her University studies.

Karolay Denisse is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her University studies

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Esforzado y optimista, así es Dionisio de 64 años, esposo de  de Espirita de 60 años y padre de 08 hijos, quienes viven en su propia casa a base de material noble. Durante 30 años, Dionisio logró abrir un Centro educativo Particular donde brinda una buena enseñanza a los niños y jóvenes de su localidad. Su mayor tiempo  lo pasa enseñando a los estudiantes de su escuela. A pesar de su edad, para él no hay ninguna discapacidad como para que ya no pueda seguir laborando en la actividad que mas le gusta, al contrario su mayor anhelo es que los niños y jóvenes de su localidad sepan sobre la computación y otros cursos, de esa manera logren  aprender a sobresalir en el futuro con una profesión. Dionisio, también se preocupa por la educación de sus hijos a quienes les brinda una buena formación y puedan ser profesionales mas adelante; además lo que ahora desea es poder ampliar su centro de computo obteniendo mas computadoras. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable como hasta ahora, además comenta su conformidad y su comodidad en su banco comunal, ya que se lleva muy bien con todas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá equipar su aula de computación comprando nuevas  maquinas de CPU, mouse, de esa forma pueda desarrollar muy bien sus clases.
texts.en:
Hard-working and optimistic are words that describe 64-year-old Dionisio.  Dionisio is married to Espirita, who is 60 years old, and is the father of eight children.  They live in their own home which is built from solid building materials.  30 years ago, Dionisio managed to open a private educational center where he provides a good education to the children and young people in his town.  He spends most of his time teaching the students in his school.  In spite of his age, this is not a handicap which will stop him from continuing to work in this business that he enjoys so much.  On the contrary, his greatest wish is for the children and young people in his town to know about computing and other courses so that they can learn to do well in the future with a profession.  Dionisio worries about the education of his children who he provides with good training so that they can become professionals in the future.  What he would like right now is to be able to expand his computing center, obtaining more computers.  

This will be Dionisio's fifth loan from MFP and he pledges to be very responsible as he has been up to now.  He also mentions his approval of and sense of ease within his community bank as he gets on very well with all the members.  Dionisio will use the 3,000 soles to equip his computing classroom, buying new CPUs and mice.  This will enable him to carry out his classes very well.

loans.use: to buy computers and mice

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 32 years old, married, and has one child.  She is from Migori town, West Kenya.  Maurine operates a hotel, which she has been doing for  three years. She earns a monthly income of  45,000 KES. 

Maurine is requesting a first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to expand her cafeteria eating area. She will use her profits to buy more foodstuffs. Her dream is to educate her child.

loans.use: to expand the eating space in his cafeteria.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es:
Henrry, trabaja como empleado en una empresa  privada de la ciudad de La Paz. También tiene un taxi del cual recibe ingresos diarios para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento para su vehiculo el cual es su herramienta de trabajo.
El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de su padre en la zona de Villa Copacabana ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO Y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Henrry works as an employee for a private business in the city of La Paz.  He also has a taxi from which he receive incomes on a daily basis to support his family.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of parts and maintenance for his vehicle, which is his tool for working.

He is single without children, and lives in his father's home in the Villa Copacabana area, which is located in the city of La Paz.

This is his second time working with IMPRO, and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase parts and conduct general maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in an old wooden house which is in the slum district of the city. He is in the auto repair repair business, which he has been doing for two years. He has many customers and gained experience in the business. 

Dashdorj is requesting a loan to renovate his house in the coming months. The house was built in early of 1980’s and has never been renovated. The walls, roof, and floor need to be insulated and the plumbing system needs to be replaced. After the renovation, the house should become well insulated from the cold weather and coal usage and emission of smoke will be much reduced.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials for his house renovation.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old single, and has one adult child. She owns a grocery store, a business she started four years ago, and earns her a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Beatrice is requesting her first loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more fruits, vegetables, and beans to sell. The anticipated profit will help her repay her loan. Her hope is to become a great business lady and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and beans.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías de 66 años es viudo hace 4 años. Tiene 6 hijos, pero ya son independientes y viven por su lado. Elías vive en una casa propia en el Barrio 2 de Mayo, en el distrito de Huasahuasi, provincia de Tarma. Elías se dedica ala agricultura. Toda su vida estuvo rodeado de cultivos y productos andinos que le dieron muchas satisfacciones como preocupaciones. A su edad todavía cuenta con las fuerzas necesarias para desenvolverse como un hombre del campo.
Él siembra  arvejas, papas, maíz y habas. Tiene que hacer esto para que, cada mes coseche y obtenga los ingresos para solventar sus gastos cotidianos.
De sus parcelas de papas obtiene como 30 sacos, los que vende en la ciudad de Huasahuasi, a compradores ya conocidos. De sus cultivos de arvejas, cosecha de 15 a20 sacos y los vende en la ciudad de Tarma, al igual que el maíz y las habas. De esa manera, pudo mantener a sus hijos, que casi siempre vienen a visitarlo y ayudarlo en las labores. Está contento con sus labores, pero es consciente que, conforme pasen los años, sus fuerzas no serán las mismas, por eso se esmera en ahorrar y trabajar en grupo. Este sería su préstamo número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Dos de Mayo”, del que se siente satisfecho y complacido por el trabajo solidario.
