Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para garantizar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Elías, 66, was widowed 4 years ago. He has 6 children who are now independent and live elsewhere. Elías lives in his own house in the “2 de Mayo” neighborhood in the district of Huasahuasi in the province of Tarma.

Elías works in agriculture. All of his life he’s been surrounded by crops and Andean products which gave him much satisfaction and worry. At his age, he’s still able to manage being a farmer. He sows peas, potatoes, corn and broad beans. He has to do this to harvest every month and that way make enough money cover his everyday costs.

From his potato plot, he harvests about 30 bags that he sells in the city of Huasahuasi to buyers he has lined up. From his pea crops, he harvests from 15 to 20 bags that he sells in the city of Tarma, as well as the corn and broad beans. That was how he was able to support his children, who come to visit him and help him with the work. He’s happy with his work, but he’s aware that, as the years go on his strength won’t be the same; that’s why he takes great pains to save money and work in groups. This would be his 8th loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his monthly payments. He’s part of the Communal Bank “Dos de Mayo” and feels satisfied and pleased by the work support.

With the loan, he’ll be able to buy 3 bags of pea seedlings and 10 bags of organic manure to guarantee the growth of the peas.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of pea seedlings and 10 bags of manure.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre casado que tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad. Él genera sus principales ingresos a partir de dos actividades emprendedoras, de vender productos naturales para la salud, y vender ropa que trae del departamento de la Guajira, especialmente mantas típicas, mercancía que es lo que mas vende en diversas temporadas del año.  Con su negocio, el cual inició hace 2 años,  Roberto ha logrado generar bienestar para su familia y eso lo entusiasma a continuar creciendo, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a su creciente clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, medicinas naturales en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos que vinieron en la oferta, con los cuales incrementará sus utilidades y ofrecerá mejores precios a sus clientes rentables, lo que hacen que esta inversión logre su éxito.
texts.en:
Roberto is a married man who has one child, age 7.  He generates his main income through his two enterprising activities: selling natural health products, and selling clothing he brings from the department of La Guajira, especially the typical ponchos which is what he sells the most in different times of the year. 

With his business, which he began two years ago, Roberto has managed to generate well-being for his family.  This makes him enthusiastic to continue growing, but his working capital is not sufficient to respond to his growing clientele.

This is why he is turning to a Kiva loan, the first loan he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he will buy natural medicines in large quantities to get special discounts that will increase his profits, and he will offer better prices to his profitable customers, which will make this investment a success.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines in large quantities.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 25 year old mother of three from the Negev. Sanaa decided to focus on gaining skills and took childcare courses through the Social Services Department. She has gained certification to manage a daycare. Sanaa found an appealing location to open her daycare but needed to make renovations before she began caring for children. 

Sanaa took this loan to pay for renovations, purchase toys, equipment and playground sand. 

Sanaa is focused on opening her daycare and wants to manage it with success. She wants to ensure her children are educated and create a secure future for them.

loans.use: To pay for renovations, purchase toys equipment and playground sand.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria  es una mujer de 41 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, tierra de las artesanías y el tejido vertical propio de las hamacas y mochilas reconocidas en todo el país. Maria tiene un negocio, que es un punto comercial donde  ofrece productos para la modistería útiles escolares, materiales de icopor y bandejas plásticas, que son de mucha salida  comercial debido a la gran de manda de los negocios de comidas,  que proliferan alrededor del suyo. En la población muchas de las mujeres con su vocación artesanal y propietaria de negocios,  encuentran en esta miscelánea los insumos que requieren para elaborar sus artesanías; el  lema  de Maria es ofrecerlos a un precio mejor que el de su competencia y en proporciones muy pequeñas, lo cual la acreditan entre todos su coterráneos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este crédito comprará artículos de hogar y mercancías variadas , especialmente productos de mercería: blorchería o cordonería que aun no vende en su negocio y que reconoce son una gran oportunidad, porque sus clientes siempre le preguntan por ellos. El negocio de Maria nació hace 10 años y esta es la experiencia que la lleva a tomar decisiones oportunas, como la de acudir a su credikiva para invertir en esta nueva línea, lo cual haría que su inversión sea exitosa. Su meta es seguir prosperando en el futuro de su negocio  y que sus 3 hijos, que hoy están en las edades de 11 a 21 años, logren alcanzar sus sueños,  con el apoyo que ella en condición de mujer separada le ofrece.
texts.en:
Maria is 41-year-old woman who lives in San Jacinto municipality in Bolivar department. This is the land of handicrafts, and vertical weaving characteristic of hammocks and backpacks, that is well-known in the whole country.

Maria has a business, which is a sales outlet where she offers dressmaking supplies, school supplies, polystyrene items, and plastic trays, which sell well, due to the great demand from food stalls that have sprouted up around hers.  

Many of the women in the town who own handicraft businesses find the supplies they need for making their crafts in her craft store. Maria's motto is to offer them at a better price than her competitors, and in very small portions. This gives her a good reputation among all her compatriots. 

Currently, she is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy household articles, and a variety of merchandise, especially sewing products that she doesn't yet sell in her business, and which she recognizes as a great opportunity, because her customers are always asking her for them. 

Maria's business was born 10 years ago, and this is the experience that leads her to make timely decisions, such as applying for a credikiva loan to invest in this new line, which would make her investment successful.

Her goal is to see her business continue to prosper in the future, and that her three children, who are now 11 and 21, succeed in reaching their dreams, with the support that she, as a separated woman, offers them.

loans.use: To buy articles for the home and a variety of merchandise, especially sewing products.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for four years. 

Viola is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Taghreed is unwilling to have her picture uploaded to the Internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband Hasan. 

Taghreed is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of four children. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance on her house with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Josphen

texts.en:
Josphen is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She makes traditional baskets to sell, which she has been doing for seven years. Her business is doing great.

Josephen is requesting her second loan from KADET  LTD, which she will use to purchase sisal fibers and threads for weaving. She hopes to make profits from the sale of her baskets. She will use these profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sisal fibres and threads.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 52-year-old married man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children. 

Mazen has a grocery store and he is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to decorate his store. 

Mazen is looking to increase the space of his home through building of additional rooms.

loans.use: to decorate his store

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ignacio es de la ciudad de Santaní, est casado y nos cuenta que su esposa es docente. Ellos son una pareja muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que tiene como objetivo trabajar y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante y progresar.
Ignacio nos cuneta que tiene una minibus en el cual trabaja con una empresa de transporte, además de este trabajo realiza la repartición de panificados a locales. Es un señor muy trabajador y muy responsable, tiene varias operaciones canceladas en forma excelente con la fundación y nos comenta que su propósito es poder ser un gran empresario y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de cubiertas, con lo cual podrá asegurar su minibus y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ignacio is from the city of Santaní. He is married and tells us that his wife is a teacher. They are a hardworking and enterprising couple. Their goal is to work and through their work get ahead and progress.  

Ignacio tells us that he has a minibus in which he works with a transportation company. In addition to this job, he delivers baked goods to locales. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. He has paid off several loans with the foundation and he tells us that his aim is to be a good businessman and thus help his family.  

He is asking help from Kiva and the Paraguaya foundation to buy covers for his minibus to protect it and keep working.

loans.use: to buy covers for a minibus.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, trabaja como ayudante de albañil realizando todo tipo de construcciones y refacciones, también tiene su taller de costura el cual le ayuda a tener ingresos extras para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar dos maquinas de costura para su taller, que le ayudaran a recibir más trabajos y consiguientemente a tener mas ingresos.
José, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez que trabaja con KIVA.
texts.en:
José works as a construction assistant, doing all different kinds of construction and repairs.  He also haw a sewing workshop which helps him to earn extra income to support his family.

He is requesting the loan to purchase two sewing machines for his workshop, which will help him to get more work and consequently to earn more income.

José is married with two children.  He lives in his parents' home in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is his second time working with IMPRO and his second time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines for his tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como odontóloga, ella tiene un consultorio donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su consultorio. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su consultorio de odontología, para comprar sillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate is a member of the Communal Bank “ATIPAY”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, both part of the province and department of Cusco.

The associate is Gabriela. She is single 35-year-old. She alternates her daily activities with work. She’s a dentist and works in her office from 8am to 7pm every day. By way of this job, she’d like to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her office. The associate is requesting a loan to buy chairs for her dentist’s office. 

The associate is happy with her loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: buy chairs for her dentist's office.

loans.name: Sadid

texts.es: Laboriosa y persistente, así es la señora Sadid de 32 años, esposa de Raúl  de 32 años y madre de 02 hijos Alex de 10 años y Linda de 03 años quienes son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos. Desde hace 04 años por acontecimientos de la vida, ella empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes. A inicios su tienda era inestable; por motivo a que no contaba con mostradores, estantes ni vitrinas para poder exhibir sus productos; por ello con la ayuda de su esposo llegaron a unir sus ingresos con la poca ganancia que generaba su tienda ya que no era muy concurrida; de esa manera llegaron a invertir poco a poco logrando comprar mostradores. A pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que llegaron a pasar, hoy su negocio es visitado por sus clientes que por la buena atención de Sadid  logró obtener. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas responsables. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá proporcionarse de mayor cantidad de abarrotes en general para tener en su tienda y de ese modo su negocio siempre este muy atrayente.
texts.en:
Hard-working and persistent, that is Mrs. Sadid, 32 years old and married to Raúl. She is the mother of two children: Alex, who is 10, and Linda, who is 3 years old. They are her motive for working so hard. Due to certain events in her life four years ago, she began to work selling groceries. At the beginning, her store was not very stable because she did not have counters, shelves, or display windows to be able to display her products. For that reason, she, along with her husband's help, saved the income from the store and little by little was able to invest in counters. Despite the difficult circumstances she has experienced, today her business is visited by customers that Sadid attracted with her good customer service.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she will be very responsible, like always. She will remain on good terms with her community bank because they are responsible people. With the 3,000 nuevos soles, she will be able to provide a greater variety of groceries for her store so that her business is always attracting customers.

loans.use: buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Jaime Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jaime Oswaldo; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, el es administrador, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta el 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de hospedaje. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su hospedaje.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Atipay Community Bank located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. His name is Mr. Jaime Oswaldo. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his business in hotel management. He works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and this business has allowed him to help his children get ahead. His dream is to expand his lodging business. He is asking for a loan for home maintenance.

He is happy about the loan and committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: with home repairs

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, es comerciante de cemento y estuco;  también realiza tejidos artesanales.
El crédito lo necesita para la construcción de una habitación en su casa, para brindar más comodidad a su familia.
Lucila, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Señora Lucila is a retailer of cement and plaster, she also does artisanal weaving.

She needs the loan to build a room on her home so as to provide better comfort for her family.

Lucila is a single mother of two children, and she lives in the Pasankery area of the city of La Paz.

This is her first time working with IMPRO, and her first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room on her home to provide better comfort for her children.

loans.name: Roger  Einer

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roger Einer; el tiene 39 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente de música, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00  a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trabajo como docente de música. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para implementar su casa.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower belongs to the Atipay Community Bank located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. His name is Mr. Roger Einer. He is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Part of his daily activities include work as a music teacher. He works form 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and wants to help his children get ahead. His dream is to improve at his job as a music teacher. He is asking for a loan to buy a television for his house. He is happy about the loan and committed to making the loan payments on time.

loans.use: buy a television for his house

loans.name: Liudvinka

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liudvinka; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente y también la socia vende zapatos para varones y mujeres, la socia vende en forma independiente desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y en las mañanas trabaja como docente, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The applicant is a member of the "ATIPAY" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, in Cusco province within the department of Cusco.

She is 40 year old Liudvinka, who lives with her partner and 2 children. Each day she alternates between working as a teacher and also selling men and women's shoes. She is a self-employed retailer from 4:00am until 8:00pm and she also teaches during the morning. Liudvinka's dream is to have a shop where she would be able to sell her shoes. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy wholesale shoes.
She is very happy about the loan and she is committed to meeting her repayments.

loans.use: To buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina, es una mujer alegre y hacendosa, tiene 35 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Teofilo de 37 años y su hijo Alberto de 11 años a quien le dedican gran parte de su vida para tenga una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad que efectúa Martina, es a cultivar sus plantas de cacao en sus campos de cultivo que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar; esta labor lo realiza hace 10 años con la ayuda de su esposo quien esta constante apoyándola para que después obtenga una buena producción. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver los frutos de buena calidad después del arduo trabajo que hacen; para ella estos productos son muy rentables porque según la producción llegan a pagar muy bien por cada kilo; es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude a lograr sus planes de trabajo. Sus planes a futuro es poder sembrar otras plantas como: hojas de coca y café, ya que también son de muy buena ganancia. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, se siente contenta por darles este apoyo y de esa manera logre cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socia alegre y solidaria. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de hojas de coca y con el resto comprará abono para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Martina is a cheerful and hard-working woman.  She is 35 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband, 37-year-old Teofilo, and her son 11-year-old Alberto to whom she dedicates a large part of her life so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  Martina's business is growing cacao plants on her farmland which she worked hard to buy.  She has been carrying out this work for 10 years with the help of her husband who constantly supports her so that she achieves a good production.  What Martina most enjoys about her work is seeing the good-quality fruit after all the hard work that she puts in.  These products are very profitable for Martina because, according to her production, she is paid very well per kilo.  For this reason, she came to MFP's offices to request a loan that would help her to achieve her work goals.  Her future plans are to sow other plants such as coca leaf and coffee as they also make good profits.

This will be Martina's second loan from MFP and she feels happy to be receiving this support which will enable her to achieve her aims.  She is a cheerful and supportive member of her community bank.  With her 2,000 soles, Martina will buy coca leaf plants and she will use the remainder to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to plant coca leaf and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mame Fatime

texts.fr:
Mame Fatime est une femme mariée elle est âgée de  35 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui sont à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le premier cycle du dit Banc Villageois.

Fatime fait du commerce de détails dans la vente de produits cosmétiques (parfums, lait de toilette, des habits prêt-à-porter depuis longtemps. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs CFA lui permettra de payer des parfums des laits de toilettes et des déodorants etc. qu'elle va revendre à ses amis du quartier.

Fatime nous informe qu'à l 'aide de ses bénéfices elle prend en charge les besoins alimentaires et vestimentaires de ses deux enfants.
texts.en:
Fatime is a 35 year-old, married woman and mother of 2 children, that she cares for.

She has been a member of the banc villageois since its first round of loans.

For a long time, Fatime has been retailing cosmetics (perfumes, cleansing creams) and ready-to-wear clothing.  She has a a lot of experience in this domain.

A new, 300000 XOF loan will allow her to purchase perfumes, cleansing creams, deodorants, and other items that she will resell to her friends in the neighborhood.  

Fatime says that she will feed and clothe her two children with the help of the profits she will make.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cleansing creams, and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es:
Diomedes, de 44 años, es una mujer activa y hacendosa; vive en su propia casa a base material noble junto a su esposo Vidal de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quines le brinda amor, cuidado y salud. Con la amabilidad y el gran carisma son atendidas la personas que acuden al puesto de ventas de la señora Diomedes; por lo tanto ella se siente muy contenta de saber que ya tiene sus clientes que cada fin de mes acuden a su tienda; la actividad que realiza es vender exclusivas prendas de vestir para niños, jóvenes y adultos; lleva realizándola  hace 13 años y comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio por su forma de atender.
Sin embargo sabe que hay mucha competencia con sus compañeras que elaboran el mismo oficio, pero ella no tiene ninguna inconveniencia con eso ya que es una mujer que sabe como ganarse a la gente sobre todo si tiene mejores prendas que ofrecer. Su mas grande anhelo es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales y tengan un buen futuro en su vida. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo y promete ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y muy responsable. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para poder traer prendas de vestir exclusivamente para la zona donde labora su venta.
texts.en:
Diomedes, 44 years old, is an active and hard-working woman. She lives in her own modest home along with her husband Vidal, 40 years old, and their 4 beloved children. She loves her children dearly and takes great care in looking after their needs. 
Diomedes sells clothes for children, young people and adults, which she has been doing for the last 13 years, and she says that her business is going well owing to her good customer service. People come to her shop because she is so well-liked and charismatic, and so she is happy in the knowledge that she has a regular client base coming to her shop each month.
However, she knows that there is a lot of competition from friends who run similar businesses. She is not put off by this as she is the sort of woman who knows how to win over her customers, especially if she has better stock to offer. Her biggest wish is for her sons to become professional people and to have bright futures.
This will be her fourth loan with MFP: she is very grateful for the support and she promises to repay her loan in a timely fashion. She is an active and very responsible member of her communal bank. With the 2,000Nuevos Soles, she intends to travel to Lima and bring back more clothing to sell in her area.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: El Pinito Group

texts.es:
Santa catalina cuenta 33 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando cesar Iván esta cursando 1° de bachiller y yareli esta en 1° de secundaria,  su esposo es policía.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende camote y dulces fuera de su casa el cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de dulces, jugos, sabritas, refrescos, y camote, santa catalina espera que su préstamo le funcione ya que dice que le va muy bien con el negocio, ya que le gustaría hacer el negocio un poco mas grande.

Santa catalina pertenece al grupo el pinito el cual esta integrado por 11 personas 9 mujeres y dos hombres los cuales todos son personas comprometidas con el trabajo a continuación serán mencionados: Juana, Prisciliana, Tobía, Julgencia, Irma, Rogaciana, Margarito, Bernardita, Irenia, Epifanía, todas trabajan con actividades comerciales como son: venta dulces, ropa, tamales, pan, camotes, productos de abarrotes, refrescos, etc.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is 33 years old.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  Cesar Iván is in his first year of high school and Yareli is in his first year of secondary education.  Her husband is a police officer.

Santa Catalina sells sweet potatoes and sweet treats outside her home.  She will invest her loan in buying sweet treats, juice, Sabritas, soft drinks and sweet potatoes.  She hopes that her loan will work out as she says that her business is doing very well and she would like to expand it a little.

Santa Catalina is a member of 'El Pinito' group which is made up of 11 people (9 women and 2 men) who are all committed to their work.  The other members are Juana, Prisciliana, Tobía, Julgencia, Irma, Rogaciana, Margarito, Bernardita, Irenia and Epifanía.  They all work in sales activities including selling sweet treats, clothes, tamales, bread, sweet potatoes, groceries, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats, Sabritas, soft drinks, juices, sweet potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (fish)

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 33 year-old man from Wasweta, an area of Migori town in the west of Kenya.  He is married to Susan and they have two children, aged two and four years.

Dominic operates a motorcycle transport business in Migori, a business he has done for the last four years.  He makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use it to buy a new motorbike. He will use the profits to pay back the loan.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glass and metal

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He sells maize in a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bags of maize for resale. 

The profit he earns from it will help him pay his children’s school fees. He hopes to raise the living standard of his family. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, de 24 años de edad, es un joven alegre y laborioso; vive en su casa propia junto a su joven pareja Giovanna de 23 años y su hija Andrea de 10 años a quien desean un buen bienestar. Edwin, es un hombre de lucro y con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir para el bien de su ámbito familiar,  por ello, desde las primeras horas de la mañana se levanta para dirigirse a su eje de trabajo, es ahí que ve la producción de sus plantas de café. Cuando realiza el mantenimiento lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja pero en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros es así que llegan a extraer de forma rápida los frutos de café. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y se siente muy contento porque es un trabajo que a él le gusta porque desde muy pequeño sus padres le inculcaron a ser un buen agricultor. Sus planes a futuro es hacer crecer sus siembras y ofrecer una buena producción a los centros de acopio donde los lleva a vender. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP y está contento por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba para seguir con sus planes de trabajo; en su banco comunal se tranquilo por trabajar con personas solidarias y responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para poder cultivarlas en su campo de cultivo.
texts.en: Edwin, 24 years old, us a bright and industrious young man. He lives in his own house together with his partner Giovanna who is 23 years old and his daughter Andrea who is 10 years old and for whom they want a good well being. Edwin, a man of profit and with many responsibilities to fulfill for the good of their family environment, therefore, from the early hours of the morning he gets up to drive himself to his hub of work. It is here that he sees the production of his coffee plants. When he does the maintenance he does it the help of his partner but at times of harvest he counts on the help of laborers. It is for this that they come to extract in a rapid way the fruits of the coffee. He has spent 10 years doing this activity and feels very happy because it is a job that he likes because from a young age his parents instilled in him to be a great farmer. His future plans are to grow his crops and offer a good yield to collection centers where he brings them to sell. This will be his 4th credit with MFP and is happy about the support that they are providing him that he needs to continue with his work plans. In his communal bank, he is eased by working with solidary and honest people. With 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy coffee plants in order to cultivate them in his crop fields.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is a 33 year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 2 years and 5 years old. He describes himself to be social and honest. He operates a barber shop where he provides shaving services. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located at a strategic residential area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the barber shop. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy another shaving machine. Bonface's business goal is to venture into a retail shop and run an informal sector, commonly known as the 'Jua kali' industry in the local language, within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have diversified his business.

loans.use: to buy another shaving machine.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es: Jimena, de 19 años, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por el momento vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su pareja Richman de 25 años. A Jimena sus padres le heredaron 01 hectárea de chacra para que pueda cultivar lo que a ella mas le guste. Así que junto a su pareja lograron sembrar plantas de cacao; producto que les hacia obtener muy buenas ganancias; es por ello que juntando los ahorros lograron comprar un terreno en la que ellos podían elaborar la construcción de su propia casa. Su dificultad es no poder avanzar con la cimentación de su vivienda por motivo a que las cosechas son por temporadas; por tal motivo sus vecinos que pertenecían a un grupo comunal le hablaron sobre los préstamos de MFP y sin duda alguna acudieron a las oficinas para solicitar un préstamo que pueda ayudarle en la culminación de su morada. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brindan y por lo tanto se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo agradece a su banco comunal por permitirles trabajar junto a ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar materiales para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
19-year-old Jimena is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead in life.  Right now, she lives in her parents' home together with her partner, 25-year-old Richman.  Jimena inherited a hectare of farmland from her parents so that she could grow some crops which is what she most enjoys doing.  Together with her partner, she managed to sow cacao plants.  This is a product that makes them very good profits.  The couple pooled their savings and bought a plot of land on which to build their own home.  Their difficulty lies in the fact that they cannot make progress in laying the foundations for their home because their harvests are seasonal.  Jimena's neighbors, who belong to a community bank, spoke to her about the loans that MFP offer and, without hesitation, she came to MFP's offices to request a loan that would help her to finish building her home.

This will be Jimena's first loan from MFP.  She feels happy with the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments on time.  She is grateful to her community bank for allowing her to work with them.  Jimena will use her 1,000 soles to buy materials so that she can finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can finish building her house

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: Sixta, de 54 años, es una mujer humilde y laboriosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Marcial de 55 años y sus 06 hijos quienes la apoyan y le dan fuerzas para seguir adelante. Su labor de Sixta, es levantarse muy temprano y preparar el desayuno de su familia  para después dirigirse a sus campos de cultivo donde realizan el cultivo de plantas de cacao y café. A veces tienen que hacer el mantenimiento como: fertilizar o eliminae la maleza que invaden sus plantaciones. Ahora ya no hace mucho esfuerzo por que sus hijos mayores le ayudan a realizar todo el trabajo; ella comenta que durante 45 años lleva laborando en la chacra y tiene el conocimiento adecuado de la siembra, cosecha y producción de las plantas de cacao y café. Su mayor anhelo es poder hacer crecer sus tierras con más sembríos y de esa forma sus hijos y ella junto a su esposo logren tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser muy puntual con las cuotas de pago para que en otra oportunidad acceda a otro. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y solidaria. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para sembrar en sus tierras de producción.
texts.en:
Sixta is 54 years old and is a humble and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Marcel, 55 years old, and their 6 children who support her and give her the strength to keep going.
Sixta rises early each day to prepare her family's breakfast and later sends them off to their respective fields to work, growing cocoa and coffee plants. Sometimes they have to do the maintenance work, such as fertilising or eliminating the weeds that invade the plantations. These days she does not have to do too much of the work because her children help her with it all. She tells us that she has been working on farms for 45 years and she has learned enough to be able to sew, harvest and produce cocoa and coffee plants.
Her greatest wish is to acquire more land for growing so that her family will have a better standard of living. This will be her 7th loan with MFP: she is aware that she has to be punctual with her repayments so that she might have the chance to borrow again. She is a responsible and trustworthy member of her communal bank. She intends to use the 2,000 Nuevos Soles to buy coffee plants to sew on her farm lands.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 32 years old. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since Felistus joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 5,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, sodas, and loaves of bread for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas, and loaves of bread for resale.

loans.name: Elvin  Ever

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 5,1 años de edad de los cuales solo uno estudia, vive en una aldea rural de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña para la venta, ya que la zona donde el cultiva es apta para esta actividad, en la cual tiene un año de trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en ella. La producción que saca la distribuye en el mercado local. Ya que de allí a logrado sacar los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su hogar. El le dedica 3 horas diarias.
Actualmente solicita su segundo préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para poder invertir en la compra de fertilizante para el cultivo. 
Su meta es lograr una mejor producción de piña, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvin, age 30, is married and has four children.  The children are 15, 11, 5, and 1; only one of them goes to school.  He lives in the rural village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

He is a farmer, and he grows pineapples to sell.  The area where he farms is suitable for this business activity.  He has been farming with much effort and dedication for one year.  The production that he gets he distributes at the local market.  That is where he has managed to get the needed resources to support his household.  He devotes three hours a day to it.

He is currently requesting his second loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for his crop.

His goal is to achieve better pineapple production in order to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, es un hombre cauto y  trabajador, tiene 33 años; vive en su propia casa junto con su esposa y sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro y buena educación. Desde hace 24 años, Félix, trabaja en su chacra labrando la tierra para luego sembrar plantas de cacao. Esta faena  lo hace con la ayuda de algunos jornaleros; a Félix le gusta éste trabajo porque desde muy pequeño le enseñaron sus padres. Aunque tenga que pasar por muchas dificultades él siempre sale adelante con los buenos cuidados que le brinda a  sus plantaciones. Los frutos cosechados lo llevan a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo que vende. Su prioridad de ahora es poder culminar con la fachada de su hogar donde vive con su familia quienes le dan fuerza para que siga adelante. Es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es un socio nuevo y agradece por el buen trato que recibe por parte de sus compañeros. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará cemento, y otras necesidades que requiera para arreglar la fachada de su hogar.
texts.en:
Félix is a careful and hard-working man.  He is 33 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children, for whom he wants to provide a good future and education.  For the past 24 years, Félix has worked his farm preparing the land to plant cacao plants.  He carries out this task with the help of some day laborers; Félix enjoys this work because it is something he learned from his parents at a very young age.

Despite the fact that he has had to face many difficulties, he always comes out ahead because of the care with which he tends to his plants.  He takes the harvested crops to sell at the stockpile centers of his locality, where he obtains good earnings for each kilo that he sells.

His current priority is to be able to complete the façade of his home, where he lives with his family; they give him the strength to forge ahead.  It is for this reason that he turns to the offices of MFP to request a loan to help carry out his plans.  This would be his 1st loan with MFP, and he feels content to be able to count on financial support in order to meet his objectives.

He is a new member of his cooperative bank, and he is grateful for the way his companions have treated him.  He will use the 1,500 soles to buy cement and other necessities for fixing his home’s façade.

loans.use: buy cement to fix his home's facade.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 53 years old. She lives in Vanadzor with her husband and a daughter. Anush’s husband works as a taxi driver and her daughter works at a clothes factory as a seamstress. But the major part of family income is thanks to Anush’s business. Anush rents a stall where she sells women’s clothes. She buys merchandize form Yerevan two or three times a month, depending on the season. Anush has many regular customers and she says she likes her occupation very much.
She has received  three loans from Nor Horizon already, and now she is asking for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy spring blouses, jackets, dresses, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to buy spring blouses, jackets, dresses, etc. to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh  meat for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 33 years old.  She is married and has 2 children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 13 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour and sodas to sell

loans.name: La Piramide Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA PIRAMIDE”; este banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.


La socia Denisse; tiene 31 años de edad; ella es soltera y la socia se dedica a trabajar en un restaurante muy conocido en el area de atencion al cliente como moza, ella se encuentra terminando de estudiar una carrera tecnica en un instituto privado, razon por la cual ahora la socia necesita invertir el prestamo en sus estudios, la socia desea terminar su carrera y asi poder tener mas oportunidades de trabajo. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en su formación academica.
La foto del socio que esta pegada a la foto grupal no estaba presente en la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios trabajan en trabajos diversos como atencion de una tienda de abarrotes,  albañileria, obras, servicios de meseros, venta de ropa, venta de comidas.


La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "La Piramide" (The Pyramid) communal bank, located in the district of Huanchac, Province of Cusco and Department of Cusco. 

The member Denisse is 31 years old. She is single and earns a living working at a restaurant very well known for its customer service, as a waitress. She is finishing up her studies in a technical field at a private institution, for which reason the member must invest the loan in her studies. The member wishes to finish her studies and thus have more work opportunities. The member seeks the loan for investing in her academic training. 

The other members work in various areas such as staffing a grocery store, construction and brickwork, wait staff, clothing sales, and prepared food sales. 

The member who is in the small photo was not present for the meeting because she asked permission to be absent for work reasons. 

The member appreciates the opportunity provided by the loan which will allow her to invest in the business and grow financially.

loans.use: to invest in her academic training.

loans.name: Maria Exilda

texts.es:
Maria de  53  años de edad es una mujer muy luchadora, casada  y con 03  hijos, tiene su casa propia en la cual vive junto a toda su familia la misma que está ubicada en  el  Caserío “Sector 0,5 Partidor” que pertenece al distrito de Las Lomas, y el mismo pertenece ala provincia de Piura. La zona en la que vive es una zona donde los pobladores se dedican a la siembra de fruta y ganadería a ala vez.

Maria y su familia se dedican la agricultura, teniendo 1,0 ha de terreno agrícola en donde actualmente tienen sembrado una plantación de mango, su terreno esta ubicado a escaso metros de la parte posterior de su casa. Su producto es cosechado y comercializado en el mercado local de la zona en la que viven y en algunas oportunidades son vendidos a clientes grandes de otros caseríos. Al negocio se dedica tanto su espos como sus hijos existiendo asi una excelente relación familiar.

Para poder ser comercializado el mango que cosechan necesitan comprar “javas” en las que se puedan transportar y evitar su deterioro, es por eso que solicitan un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 500 Nuevos Soles para poder mejorar la calidad de atención  a sus clientes, y así día a día hacer crecer su negocio lo que le pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida


Su mismo negocio ha hecho que Maria se gane el cariño y respeto de sus vecinos de quienes recibe admiración.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and is a woman with a fighting spirit. She is married and has three children. She has her own house where she lives with her whole family. The house is located in the "Sector 0,5 Partidor" neighborhood, which is in the Las Lomas district in the province of Piura. The area she lives in is home to people who make their living planting fruit and in animal husbandry.

Maria and her family make their living in agriculture. They have one hectare of agricultural land where right now they have planted a mango plantation. Their land is located just a few meters from the back of the house. The produce is harvested and sold in the local market of the regions they live in. Sometimes they can sell to large customers in other areas. Her husband and children work in the business as well and as such they have an excellent family life. 

To be able to sell the mangoes that they pick they need to buy "javas" [a receptacle used as a measure for sales of produce] in which they will be able to transport them and avoid damaging them. This is why they are requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 nuevos soles in order to improve the quality of their customer service and day by day make their business grow which will give her a better quality of life. 

Her business has won her the care and respect of her neighbors by whom she is admired.

loans.use: buy "javas" to easily transport mangoes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old grocery store owner in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is single.  She has been selling groceries for the past five years with great success.

This marks her first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. With the loan, she plans to purchase more kales, cabbages, carrots and tomatoes. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and repay her loan. 

She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: buy kales, cabbages, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old. She lives in the village of Mukhrovani in East Georgia with her family: husband – Temur, 30-year-old son and a daughter-in-law. Temur works in a Security Service provider company.  Her son is a worker in the village and daughter-in-law works as a teacher in the village school. Mary is leading the small-scale agricultural business for her family. She takes care of a milk cow, produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells on average 15 kg of this product on local market.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris.

Mary requested credit to purchase a milk cow. She will produce and sell double the amount of cheese and the income of the family will increase. Mary plans to purchase additional household goods with the increased income in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa, a 51-year-old married mother of three children, has owned a grocery store since 2006, and most of her clients are neighbors, friends and relatives.

Working hard on expanding her business, Latifa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise stock with special detergents and requested items. She is putting much hope in this loan because she believes it will help her provide her customers with most of their needs.

Latifa hopes to expand her business more in the future to fulfill all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise stock with special detergents and requested items.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 48 años de edad es una madre muy trabajadora y emprendedora a la vez, vive con su esposo y sus 02  hijos en su casa propia la cual ha sido construido en base a su arduo trabajo, su casa está ubicada en  el  Caserío “Viviano Espinoza” del Distrito de Las Lomas perteneciente a  Provincia de Piura la cual esta a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo, su caserío esta en vía de desarrollo por lo que en la actualidad solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica. 

La actividad económica a la que se dedica Hermelinda es a la venta al por menor de ropa de niños y adultos la cual la distribuye recorriendo de lunes a sábado todos los caserío aledaños al suyo, ya cuenta con algunos clientes fijos por lo que esta al tanto de sus pedidos que realizan de manera quincenal o mensual, adicionalmente aprovecha también para ofrecer un producto adicional que son los zapatos lo que ha creído que es el complemento de su negocio principal.
Su esposo se dedica de manera diaria a dar servicio de transporte por lo que alquila un vehiculo que transporta a los pasajeros de pueblo en pueblo, así trabajando ambos han decidido salir adelante en el negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dar mejor alimentación y educación a sus hijos.

Hermelinda cree que aun tiene clientes por captar y con sus metas bien establecidas desea invertir en la compra de variedades tanto de prendas de vestir como de zapatos por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles lo que ayudara a cumplir con sus objetivos.

Hermelinda es una mujer de buen carácter y muy trabajadora, cuanta con muy buenas referencias por los vecinos de caserio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 48 years old and a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother.  She lives with her husband and 2 children in her own house, which has been built on the foundation of hard work.  Her home is located in the village “Viviano Espinoza”, in the Las Lomas district of the Piura province.  This area is located about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Her village is still being developed and, as a result, currently only has electrical service.

Hermelinda dedicates herself to selling children and adult clothing at retail, which she distributes by travelling through her village and neighboring areas on foot.  She already counts on some fixed customers, who place orders once or twice per month.  Additionally, she takes advantage of offering another product, footwear, as she believes it is complimentary to her primary product lines.

Her husband dedicates himself to being a driver on a daily basis, for which he rents a vehicle to transport customers from town to town.  Working together, they have both been able to improve their family’s standard of living, and provide better nutrition and an education for their children.

Hermelinda believes she still has customers to attract and, with her goals well-established, she wants to invest in the purchase of a variety of products such as clothing and shoes.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,500 Peruvian soles that will help her meet her objectives.

Hermelinda is a woman of strong character and a very hard worker.  She has very good references from the neighbors in the village.

loans.use: buy a variety of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 50 años, convive con José, con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, de 21 y 15 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en el barrio Esperanza, en el distrito de Huasahuasi, provincia de Tarma. Victoria se dedica al trabajo del campo. Cuenta con terrenos agrícolas que le permiten sembrar papas de distintas variedades. En este trabajo la ayudan su esposo y sus hijos mayores, por lo que se siente respaldada.
Además se encarga de criar animales de granja como: vacas y toros. Tiene 3 vacas lecheras que le proporcionan la leche necesaria para preparar quesos, “al día elaboro 5 moldes de quesos y los vendo rápido a 5 soles cada uno”; afirma; y si no se abastece con ellos, compra otros moldes a 3 soles, para ofrecerlos a casi al doble. 
Cuenta con 14 carneros, y 3 becerros, los que ahora está criando para luego, después de 5 ó 6 meses, comercializar.  Normalmente compra un carnero a 60 soles y después de 6 meses de ensebarlo lo vende a 240 soles. En cuanto a sus toros, los alquila al día a 25 soles, para su uso como yuntas. Así genera ingresos por varias partes. De esa manera Victoria sale adelante y mantiene su hogar. Ahora piensa adquirir más animales para mejorar sus ventas y bastecer a sus compradores. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Dos de Mayo”, y está contenta de pertenecer al grupo por el trabajo solidario.
Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de una vaca lechera para elaborar quesos, ya que su negocio también es rentable e inmediato.
texts.en:
Victoria, 50, lives with José, with whom she has seven children, but she lives with only two of them, ages 21 and 15.  This family lives in their own home in the Esperanza neighborhood in the district of Huasahuasi, province of Tarma.

Victoria works in farming.  She has farmland that allows her to grow different types of potato.  Her husband and her older children help her with this job, so she feels supported.

She also is responsible for raising farm animals such as cows and bulls.  She has three dairy cows that give her the milk she needs to make cheese: "I make five molds of cheese and sell them quickly for five PEN each," she says.  And if she cannot stock up with them, she buys other molds for three PEN, to offer at almost double.

She has 14 sheep and three calves that she is raising now to sell later, after five or six months.  Normally she buys a sheep for 60 PEN and sells it for 240 after six months of penning it.  With regard to her bulls, she rents them out for 25 PEN a day for use as yokes.  In this way she generates income in different ways.  This way Victoria gets ahead and supports her home.  Now she plans to acquire more animals to improve her sales and supply her buyers.

This will be the eighth loan she will receive from MFP, so she promises to be punctual in making her monthly payments.  She belongs to Dos de Mayo Communal Bank, and she is happy to belong to the group because it is supportive work.

She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of a dairy cow to make cheeses, because her business also is profitable and immediate.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en:
Manasseh is a married man, aged 66 years old.  His children are aged 45 and 25 years old.  His wife is a small-scale farmer, hence adding some income to the family.  Manasseh is a brick seller as well as a brick maker in Kaptuiywo, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.  

Manasseh has applied for his first term loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase bricks for resale.  The anticipated profit will be used to plough back into the business and for his family upkeep.  He hopes to prosper in his brick business and educate his child.

loans.use: buy bricks

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man, aged 36 years old.   He is blessed with two children, aged eight and six years old.  His spouse owns a retail shop thus adding income to the family.   

Benson owns a timber yard in the Kaptuiya trading centre and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of  KES 13,000.

Benson is servicing a first loan cycle of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD.  He  wishes to use the amount to purchase more timber for resale.  The anticipated profit will be used to plough back into the business and for his family upkeep.  He hopes to prosper in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: buy timber

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. She is an  honest woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks like doughnuts etc.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a good area where theres no disturbance by the city council due to health problems.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients to prepare food for sellling. Linet's  business goal is to own a restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, a 53-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from 22 to 35 years, describes herself to be a God-fearing woman. For the past three years she has operated a grocery store selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, sugar cane, onions, kale, oranges, mangoes, potatoes, etc. Her business is located in a viable area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the grocery store.

Lela will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell, and her business goal is to be a tomato distributor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Kadide

texts.en:
Kadide is a married woman.  She has 5 children who are all enrolled in school. Kadide operates a goat meat selling business. She has worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be livestock death due to sickness.  Her highest monthly expense is food.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kadide will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more goats for resale. Kadide aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: buy goats

loans.name: Melva Albertina

texts.es:
Melva, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio, comprara maíz, leña, para mantener en el inventario, esto le ayuda a poder aumentar la producción en un determinado momento, sin ninguna dificultad.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado a prosperar y mejorar sus circunstancias de vida, estas compras periodicas son producto de la buena demanda que tiene en el negocio, cancelando ya su tercer prestamo.
texts.en:
Melva is requesting a new loan to buy supplies for her activity. She will buy maize and firewood to keep her inventory stocked up, as this will help her increase her production in a given timeframe without any inconveniences.
She believes that these loans have helped her being successful and improving her standard of living. These periodical purchases are the result of the good demands her activity receives, thanks to which she has already repaid her third loan.

loans.use: To buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 22 años y es un joven independiente. Vive solo en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Ramón en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Hace 2 años que decidió vivir solo, por problemas de convivencia con la nueva pareja de su madre. Desde entonces trabaja con empeño para pagar el alquiler de su cuarto y para su alimento diario. Gracias a su desenvolvimiento pudo comprase una moto taxi con la que trabaja todos los días haciendo servicio de transporte dentro de su localidad. “Es rentable, por que trabajo desde la madrugada y si quiero ganar más hasta muy noche, eso ya depende de cada uno”, menciona.
Pero Juan es inteligente, sabe que es lo que le conviene. A veces labora en las minas mediante contratas y se ausenta de San Ramón como 3 meses, pero cada vez que retorna, continúa trabajando con su moto taxi. 
Juan está ahorrando para comprarse un terreno y más adelante construir su propia casa. Es un joven ejemplar, pues también tiene muchas ganas de participar en su banco comunal por el trabajo en equipo. Sería la primera vez que Juan accedería a un préstamo de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está contento y entusiasmado de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Puente Centenario”. De recibir el dinero, Juan podrá arreglar su movilidad, comprándole nuevas llantas y tolderas. Así como tapizar sus asientos y cambiar las luces.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 years old.  He is an independent young man who lives alone in a rental house in San Ramón district, in Chanchamayo province.  Two years ago he decided to start living alone because of problems that he was experiencing living alongside his mother's new partner.  Since then he has been working hard to pay the rent on his room and pay for his daily food.  Thanks to the progress he has made, he has been able to buy a motorcycle taxi with which he works every day, providing a transport service in his town.  "It is profitable because I work from early in the morning and, if I want to earn more, I work until very late at night.  It depends on the individual," he says.

However, Juan is intelligent.  He knows that this is what he wants to do.  He sometimes does contract work in the mines and leaves San Ramón for something like three months.  However, every time he returns he continues working with his motorcycle taxi.

Juan is saving up to buy a plot of land so that he can build his own home in the future.  He is an exemplary young man as he also has a great desire to participate in his community bank, working as a team.  This is the first time that Juan has requested a loan from MFP.  He is grateful for their help and so he pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He is happy and keen to belong to his community bank which is called "Puente Centenario".  With his money, Juan will be able to repair his vehicle, buying new tires and canopies.  He will also upholster his seats and replace his lights.

loans.use: to buy tires and canopies, and to upholster his seats

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida, de 28 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Cirilo de 31 años; quienes desean tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ida, una mujer empeñosa a la actividad que realiza; es decir se dedica a ver sus plantas de cacao que llegó ha sembrar hace más de 16 años y ahora ve las cosechas en cada temporada. En tiempos de recolección de cacao lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja y algunos jornaleros quienes apoyan para que pueda extraer rápido los frutos. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder tener buena producción y llevarla a vender a buenos precios que faciliten sus gastos. Considera difícil el tener que llevar a los centros de acopio que se encuentran a media hora de su localidad; ahora lo primordial desea realizar el desyerbo de malezas que oprimen sus plantaciones. Este será su crédito numero 05 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas. En su banco comunal es una mujer solidaria y responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que puedan ayudarle sacando la malezas de su siembra.
texts.en:
Ida, 28, lives in her own house with her partner Cirilo, 31. They both wish to have a better quality of life. She is a hard-working woman, fully dedicated to grow cocoa in a plantation which she started more than 16 years ago and now harvests every season. In harvesting times, her partner and day laborers help her so she can collect the fruits quickly. What she likes most about her work is being able to have a good production and sell it at a good price in order to justify the expenses. She considers that it is hard to take the produce to the storage centers, located 30 minutes away from her community. 
Ida’s goal now is to get rid of the weeds that affect her plants. This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to have the loaners’ support. She is a responsible, supportive member of her communal bank. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, Ida will hire day laborers to help her taking the weeds off her plantation.

loans.use: hire day laborers

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married woman. She has 6 children and 5 are enrolled in school. Mesalim operates a retail shop and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mesalim will use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for resale. Mesalim aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and beans

loans.name: Carringtone

texts.en: Carringtone is a 37-year-old married man with three children, aged 14, 11 and 8.  He started farming four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.  He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase hay and other animal feeds for his cows. The profit he makes will help him buy another cow.   His dream is to see his cows produce over 200 litres of milk so as to get sufficient income to educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: buy hay and animal feeds

loans.name: Emilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Emilia, necesita realizar una nueva inversión en la compra de telas de varios colores, por esto solicita un nuevo préstamo que le ayude a realizar la inversión, mejorando la capacidad del taller.
Ella manifiesta haber mejorado con la compra anterior, que suplió la necesidad que atravesaba en ese momento.
texts.en:
Emilia needs to invest anew in the purchase of fabric of different colors, and for this reason she is requesting a new loan that will help her make the investment, thus improving the capacity of her workshop.
She says she has improved thanks to her previous purchase, as she has been able to fulfill the need she was facing at that moment.

loans.use: To buy fabric of different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic household products for her store.  She will also buy pans for preparing her food

loans.name: Greyse Zulema

texts.es:
Greyse es una mujer de 49 años, tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su restaurante el rinconcito. 
Empezó cuando tenía restaurante hace 10 años su trabajo lo hace sola con un niño del barrio él le ayuda con las compras, no tiene dificultades, está casada su marido trabaja haciendo fletes en una camioneta, no tiene hijos.

Su sueño es arreglar su casa y mejorar la fachada de su negocio. Pero el prestamo lo quiere para comprar viveres para hacer mas comida como arroz, lentejas, aliños, carnes etc.
texts.en:
Greyse is a 49-year-old woman with very high expectations to make her business grow within the next few years. She started her restaurant “El Rinconcito” (The Little Corner), 10 years ago. She works on her own and a boy from the neighborhood helps her doing the shopping. She has not faced any difficulties. She is married and her husband works transporting goods in a truck. She has no children. 
Greyse’s dream is to fix her house and improve her business’ façade. However, she’s asking for this loan in order to purchase groceries such as rice, lentils, spices, meats and so on, in order to make more food.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, spices, meats, etc.

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 65 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous à sa charge.
 
Elle pratique du petit commerce dans la vente de légumes et d'épices, une activité qu'elle mène depuis longtemps. C'est pourquoi elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur d'activité.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 450000 francs CFA elle va acheter des oignons des choux ,des carottes ,du poivre du piment destinés à la revente au détails.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge à la dépense quotidienne de sa maison (payement eau et électricité).Elle parvient aussi à faire des épargnes dans son compte au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou is a 65-year-ols married woman and mother of four dependent children.

She works in small trade, selling vegetables and spices. She has considerable experience in this activity, having worked in this particular sector for a long time. 

She will use her new loan of 450,000  CFAF to buy onions, peppers, cabbage, carrots, and pepper to sell at retail.

Her profits will allow her to help with the household’s daily expenses (water and electricity). She will also increase her savings at the local Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for resale.

loans.name: Odalys Marleny

texts.es:
Odalys de 23 años de edad es madre soltera muy trabajadora y emprendedora a la vez, vive con su hijo en su casa propia la cual ha sido construido en base a su arduo trabajo, su casa está ubicada en  el  Caserío “Pedregal” del Distrito de Tambogrande perteneciente a  Provincia de Piura la cual esta a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo, su caserío esta en vía de desarrollo por lo que en la actualidad solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica. 



La actividad económica a la que se dedica Odalys es a la venta al por menor de ropa de niños y adultos la cual la distribuye recorriendo de lunes a sábado todos los caserío aledaños al suyo, ya cuenta con algunos clientes fijos por lo que esta al tanto de sus pedidos que realizan de manera quincenal o mensual, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de y posterior comercialización de ganado menor como ovino, porcinos entre otros, ah dichas actividades ya viene dedicándose un aproximado de 3 años, actividades que han generado que ahora tenga su casa propia y su negocio este creciendo día a día. Así trabajando ha decidido salir adelante para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dar mejor alimentación y educación a su hijo.



Odalys cree que aun tiene clientes por captar y con sus metas bien establecidas desea invertir en la compra de variedades de prendas de vestir y a la vez alimentos balanceados para lograr un mejor crecimiento y engorde del ganado que actualmente tiene en sus corrales, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa un monto de 500 Nuevos Soles lo que ayudara a cumplir con sus objetivos.



Odalys es una mujer joven y trabajadora y de buen carácter, cuenta con muy buenas referencias por los vecinos de su caserío.
texts.en:
Odalys, who is 23 years old, is a single mother who is very hard-working and at the same time entrepreneurial. She lives with her son in her own house, which has been constructed on the base of her hard work. Her house is located in the small village of Pedregal in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the province of Piura, which is about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Her village is in the process of development, and so now they only have electrical service.

Odalys' business is the retail sale of clothing for children and adults, which she distributes by going through all the towns bordering on hers from Monday to Saturday. She already has some regular customers, so she is up to date with their orders, which they place every two weeks or monthly. In addition, she raises and later sells small livestock such as sheep and pigs, among others. She has been working at these businesses for about three years, and they have generated enough income that now she has her own house and her business is growing day by day. Working this way she has decided to more forward to improve her living conditions and to give better food and education to her son.

Odalys believes that she still has customers to win over, and with her well-established goals she wants to invest in the purchase of a variety of articles of clothing and at the same time in balanced feed to achieve better growth and fattening of the livestock that she now has in her corrals. For this reason she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 500 PEN, which will help her achieve her goals.

Odalys is a hardworking young woman of good character. She has very good references from the neighbors in her village.

loans.use: to buy a variety of articles of clothing to sell, and at the same time, balanced feed for the livestock she is raising

loans.name: Kerin Fernando

texts.es:
Kerin, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en productos para el negocio de helados, su compra será en sorbetes de diferentes sabores, paletas, conos, y otra variedad de productos de sorbeteria.
Él considera que se ha mantenido en su condición, que el negocio ha estado estable y conto con los productos necesarios para darle salida a la demanda.
texts.en:
Kerin has decided asking for a new loan to invest it in the purchase of supplies for the ice-cream sale activity. He will buy different flavors of sherbets, popsicles, cones and other kinds of products for the ice-cream parlor.
He thinks that his conditions have not varied, that his activity has remained stable and he says that he had all the products he needed to meet his requests.

loans.use: To buy different flavors of sherbets, popsicles and cones.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia de 22 años convive con Celio con quien tiene una hija de 6 años. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Dalia se dedica a la carpintería y artesanía. Es su negocio propio. Fabrica cucharones, morteros y otros utensilios de cocina de madera. Para ello compra la madera “Diablo Fuerte”, que es la indicada para elaborar estos artículos. Lleva 3 años en esta actividad, y ya vende sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo. “Tengo pedidos de 1000 a 2000 cucharones a la quincena, para eso viajamos seguido”, comenta. Haciendo sus cálculos, Dalia obtiene alrededor de 2500 soles al mes, siempre y cuando el trabajo sea coordinado y constante. 
Ella menciona que, para elaborar 4 cucharones utiliza 1 pie de madera que le cuesta 1 sol y 50 céntimos. Cada cucharón lo comercializa a 1 sol y 20 céntimos. Es decir de 3000 pies de madera obtiene 15 000 cucharones. Sus ganancias son considerables si vende al por mayor. 
Sus metas son claras y ambiciosas. Ahora piensa abrir su mercado hacia Tacna y con suerte exportará hacia Chile, dependerá de cómo canalice sus contactos por el país vecino. Esta sería la primera vez que Dalia obtendría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal “Puente Centenario”, por que sabe que así sus metas pueden alcanzarse más rápidamente.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de madera “Diablo Fuerte”, para eso visitará las chacras. Adquirirá 1000 pies de maderas para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
22-year-old Dalia lives with her partner Celio.  The couple have a 6-year-old daughter.  This family lives in a rental house in San Ramón district, in Chanchamayo province.  Dalia's business is carpentry and making handicrafts.  It is her own business.  She makes ladles, mortars and other wooden kitchen utensils.  She buys 'Diablo Fuerte' (Devil Strong) wood which is what should be used for making these items.  She has been in this business for three years and she sells her products in the city of Huancayo.  "I have orders for 1,000 to 2,000 ladles a fortnight," she says.  Doing her calculations, Dalia earns around 2,500 soles a month whenever her work is coordinated and constant.
