Dalia says that in order to make 4 ladles, she uses one foot of wood which costs her 1 sol and 50 centimes.  She sells each ladle for 1 sol and 20 centimes.  She gets 15,000 ladles from 3,000 feet of wood.  Her profits are considerable if she sells wholesale.

Dalia's goals are clear and ambitious.  She plans to open her market toward Tacna and, with a bit of luck, she will start exporting to Chile.  It will depend on how she channels her contacts in the neighboring country.

This is the first time that Dalia has requested a loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  She is happy to belong to her community bank (Puente Centenario) because she knows that it will enable her to reach her goals more quickly.  She will invest her money in buying "Diablo Fuerte" wood and will visit the farms to do this.  She will acquire 1,000 feet of wood so that she can continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 feet of wood

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes son la señora Maria Manuela va a comprar con su prestamo maiz, la señora Virginia va a comprar cerdos y alimento para engordarlos, la señora Eva va a comprar carne, tortillas, verduras, nopales para elaborar taquitos. La señora María del Carmen tiene 27 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, eles campesino, ellos tiene 3 hijas, 2 estudian la primaria y otra preescolar, ella vende tamales, atole y tacos de arroz, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar carne, arroz, aceite, huevo, salchichas, papa, cebolla, hojas para tamal, maíz, manteca, chocolate, harina, canela, azúcar y carbón,  ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años su mama tenia un negocio igual y le ayudaba a cocinar, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para comprar frutas o algunos gastos de la escuela de sus hijas. Ella se siente orgullosa cuando sus clientes de dicen que su comida esta sabrosa, ella sale con su carrucha a ofrecer sus productos en la plaza a los comerciantes, ama de casa, ella está planeando contratar a una persona para que venda los alimentos y así abarcar mas lugares para la venta, su negocio le ha ayudado a su familia cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo de ahí toma para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son poner un local para tener más provecho de su negocio,  tener una ayudante para que salga a vender sus productos a la plaza con los comerciantes, que sus hijos sigan estudiando apoyándolos. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad Gracias por sus préstamos, nos brindan su apoyo y confianza sin conocernos y no les vamos a defraudar”.
texts.en:
The new members (of the communal bank) are Señora Maria Manuela, who is going to buy corn with her loan; Señora Virginia, who is going to buy pigs and food to fatten them; Señora Eva is going to buy meat, tortillas, vegetables, and prickly pears to make taquitos. 

Señora Maria de Carmen is 27 years old. She lives in a common law marriage with her husband, who is a farm worker. They have three daughters, of whom two are in primary school and one is in preschool. She sells tamales, atole (a hot corn-based beverage), and rice tacos. She is applying for a loan to buy meat, rice, oil, eggs, sausages, potatoes, onions, leaves to wrap tamales, corn, lard, chocolate, flour, cinnamon, sugar, and charcoal. She began this business two years ago. Her mother had a similar business and helped her cook. Her business is important because she has income to buy fruit or pay for some of the school expenses of her daughters. She feels proud when her customers tell her that her food is delicious. She goes out with her cart to offer her products to the merchants in the plaza. As a housewife, she is planning to hire a person to sell food and thus reach more sales locations. Her business has helped her family when her husband didn't have work, as they take from the business for food.  Her dreams and hopes are to set up a place that will offer more advantages to her business, to have a helper to go out to sell her products on the plaza with the merchants, and to help her children continue to go to school.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Real, "Thank you for your loans. You offer us your support and confidence without knowing us, and we are not going to disappoint you."

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, eggs, sausages, potatoes, onions, leaves to wrap tamales, corn, lard, chocolate, flour, cinnamon, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Muntop

texts.en:
Muntop is a 30-year-old, married businesswoman living in Juba. She and her husband have one child. Their child is four years old and attends school.

Muntop runs a small restaurant and bar business, which she has operated for four years. She has two employees. Within five years, Muntop would like to run a big restaurant and bar. She explains that her major challenges include a low current rate of income and increasing living expenses.

Muntop heard about Finance Sudan through her fellow clients. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000 SDG to purchase more food items to be cooked as well as more beer and soda. Muntop says that she is thankful for Finance Sudan’s support because it helps her improve her finances.

loans.use: to purchase additional food (to be cooked) and drinks (beer and soda)

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne used a previous loan to buy chicken feed for her poultry business. In her business, she faces challenges due to price fluctuations and inflation. However, her dream is to educate her children up to the university level.

Her business goal is to move her business to a more permanent location. To that end, Joselyne is seeking a new loan to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Mame Cheikh Anta Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Mame Cheikh Anta Mbacké a été crée le 24-12-2010. Il est composé de 13 femmes toutes issues du même quartier et exerçant la activité qui est le commerce.

La responsable Saye,debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle développe un petit commerce de poissons séchés et poissons fumés; Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs annés

Avec son prêt reçu elle va acheter du poissons fumés et séchés qu'elle va revendre au détail dans le quartier.

Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et renforcer ses épargnes dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Mame Cheikh Anta Mbacké was created on December 24, 2010. It consists of 13 women from the same neighborhood and working in trade.

The head of the group is Saye, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She runs a small business selling dried fish and smoked fish. She has many years of experience in this activity. 

She will use this loan to buy smoked fish and dried fish to sell at retail in the neighborhood. 

The profits earned will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions and to boost her savings at the local Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 38-year-old woman living in the Airport community. She has four children between the ages of 2 and 23.

For the past two years Sarah has been operating a restaurant, where she enjoys seeing a constant flow of customers. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, onions, salt, and coal for her business. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods (such as pepper, rice, onions, salt, and coal) for her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 55-year-old, married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

To earn a living, he owns and operates a restuarant that he started five years ago. He explains that his main business challenges are customers that do not pay on time and high taxes that are levied on him. His dream is to educate his children at higher institutions of learning and to expand his business into new markets.

Francis is seeking a loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Ndéye Sarr

texts.fr:
Madame Ndéye est une femme âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 02/12/2008 
Ndéye pratique du petit commerce par la vente de produits divers (encens, chaussures, et tissus etc.)

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter de l'encens ,des chaussures, et des tissus qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va satisfaire les besoins alimentaires de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ndéye is a 58-year-old woman.  She is married and has one child.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 12/02/2008.  Ndéye is involved in retail: she sells various goods such as incense, shoes, fabrics etc.
With her new loan, she will buy some incense, shoes and fabrics, and resell them for retail in her own neighborhood.  She has a good experience in her field, since she has been involved in this activity for a long time.
With the profits, she will take care of her child's food needs.

loans.use: to buy incense, shoes and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman. She has four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

To earn a living, Kache operates a retail shop. Her primary customers are the local area's community members. She explains that her primary business challenge is that her customers do not repay their debts on time and that her highest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

Kache is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale purposes. Kache aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funding to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil) for resale.

loans.name: Muslum

texts.ru: Muslum zanimaetsa torgovley, on prodaet zanaveski dla okon i paralelno vedet skotovodstvo vo dvore svoego doma. On prodaet myaso i moloko na bazare. Emu 54 goda, on jenat i u nego 3 starshix detey. Muslum nachinal svoe delo s odnoy korovi i blagoda kreditam chto on bral do etogo iz "VF Azercredit" on kupil neskolko korov i rasshiril svoy biznes. Segodna emu nujni dengi dla remonta stoyla jivotnix i dla pokupki korma dla korov. On ochen spokoyniy i terpeliviy chelovek i uverenno idet k svoey celi.
texts.en: Muslum is in sales, he sells curtains for windows and also runs a household with livestock in the yard of his house. He sells meat and milk on the market. He is 54 years old, he is married and has three children. Muslum started his business with one cow and thanks to the loans which he took out from VF Azercredit he bought several more cows and expanded his business. Today he needs money to repair the stalls for the livestock and to buy fodder for cows. He is a very calm and patient man and works towards his goal with confidence.

loans.use: to make repairs in the animal stalls.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old, married, and blessed with five children aged 20, 18, seven, five, and three years. She owns a grocery store, a business she started fifteen years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, and maize required by her customers. The profit she earns will help her repay her loan. Her hope is to expand her business. This is her fifth loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Serigne Cheikh Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Serigne Cheikh  a été crée le 24-12-2010. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même village et exerçant la activité qui est le commerce.
La responsable Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant.
Avec son prêt reçu elle va acheter du mil et de l'arachide.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et assurer la dépense quotidienne
texts.en: The solidarity group Serigne Cheikh was created on 12/24/2010.  It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same village and work in retail.  The facilitator of the group, Amy, standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, is 58 years old.  She is married and has one child.  With her loan she will buy some millet and groundnut.  The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and to contribute to everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet and groundnut.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en: Zuma is a married man. He has 3 children, and all are enrolled in school. Zuma operates a retail shop. His primary customers are members of the local community. He describes his greatest business challenge as customers refusing to pay their debts on time, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Zuma will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. Zuma aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old. She lives in the Airport community, and she has four children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. One of her children is in college, working and living on her own, while the three younger ones are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past fifteen years Esther has been selling cosmetics in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plans are to build a house and send her younger children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with eight children, and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Margaret is a poultry farmer who works from her home. She also gets additional income from selling firewood. She works seven days a week, and she has been in this business for the last 10 years. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of chicken feeds and chicks. Her major business challenges are transporting the chicken feeds, thieves, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own 2000 chickens and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 39-year-old lady from Kakamega County, in western Kenya. She is married to John and they have children aged 20, 17, 14, and eight years.

Monica operates a dressmaking business where she makes schools uniforms and sells dressmaking supplies. She has been in this business for the last 13 years, making a monthly income of KES 9,900. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy textiles for making school uniforms. She will use profits to to buy more textiles. Her dream is to educate and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en: Tsuma is a married man. He has 3 children, and 2 are enrolled in school. Tsuma operates a meat goat-selling business, and he sells his livestock at the market. His primary customers are local community members. He describes his greatest business challenge as livestock deaths due to animal sickness, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Tsuma will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase more goats for resale. Tsuma aspires to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Janjan

texts.en: Janjan is 36 years old, and she lives in the Airport community. She has two children, aged 5 and 9 years old. For the past two years, Janjan has been  selling bitter ball (an African eggplant). She enjoys the flowing of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball (African eggplants) for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 25-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be humble and a team player. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of clothes. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase clothes for selling. 

Anna's business goal is to be a distributor of clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old and single. She owns a private school in Mariakani. She has been running the school for the past seven years. The business is doing great.

This marks her second loan from KADET  Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to renovate the school. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase new desks and repay her loan

She dreams of having the best-performing school in the province.

loans.use: to renovate the school.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has been making her own, unique pesto sauce since 1993 and has been selling it from her small home business. She currently offers three different flavors that are made from her all natural, garden-fresh ingredients. Yolanda goes further in insuring a quality product by packaging it in light-weight PET jars that are easily recycled or reused, rather than bulky and breakable glass jars. For some time she has used her own kitchen to produce her sauce, however, recently she has been given the opportunity to use a commercial kitchen through a local business incubator. 

Currently, Yolanda operates without any employees and still maintains a full-time job at EmblemHealth. In the near future, she hopes to grow her business to the point where she can bring on new employees and become self-reliant. The purpose of this loan will be to buy bulk inventory and move into a commercial kitchen. She would also like to use it to patent her sauces and participate in food craft shows and farmers markets.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory, open new markets, and expand manufacturing.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a resident of the Greater Boston area and the owner of Green City Growers (GCG), a green company that builds, installs, and maintains year-round organic raised-bed vegetable gardens for a number of markets. Some of her customers include local homeowners, businesses/corporations, schools and restaurants in the Northeast.

 In addition to this initial goal, Jessie has recently diversified to include products for specific market niches such as gardening maintenance projects, Green City Growers schoolyard educational programs, corporate willingness programs and restaurant on-site productions. Jessie hopes to continue to grow her business and empower her community. This loan will help her do so by allowing the purchase of bulk inventory and more effectively marketing her business throughout the community.

loans.use: to purchase bulk inventory for her business and do marketing.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda de 34 años está casada con Rodrigo hace 11 años. Tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Hilda es una mujer laboriosa y responsable. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con 5 cuadras de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra café, cítricos, maíz, yuca y plátanos. Gracias a la variedad de sus cultivos puede solventar sus gastos familiares en todo el año. Así también, ella y su esposo son transportistas, para ello cuentan con 2 moto taxis propias. Una de ellas la maneja Rodrigo y la otra, un joven a quien pagan por sus servicios de chofer.
Con ambas actividades, Hilda y su familia pueden satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y algunos gustos, como paseos familiares. Hilda está contenta con su trabajo y sus logros. De esa manera piensa ampliar más sembríos de café, por la gran demanda que existe en la zona.
Ahora está más centrada en sus moto taxis por que sus sembríos ya fueron atendidos y espera paciente las cosechas. Esta sería la primera vez que Hilda obtendría un crédito de MFP gracias a su ayuda. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puente Centenario”, se siente cómoda y emocionada por el trabajo que se realizará. De recibir el dinero, invertirá en el pago por al revisión técnica de sus movilidades, el registro y trámites en la municipalidad para trabajar con formalidad y cambiar de luces y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
Hilda is 34 years old and has been married to Rodrigo for 11 years.  She has 2 children who are 16 and 14 years old.  She and her family live in their own home in the San Ramón District of Chanchamayo Province.  Hilda is a hard-working and responsible woman.  Together with her husband, she earns a living in agriculture.  She has 5 blocks of agricultural land on which she has planted coffee, citrus fruits, corn, yucca and bananas.  Thanks to the variety in her crop, she can meet her family's expenses all year long.  In addition, she and her husband work in transportation.  For that business, they have 2 of their own moto-taxis.  Rodrigo drives one of them, and they pay a young man to drive the other.
With both businesses, Hilda and her family can meet their basic needs and some pleasures, like family outings.  Hilda is happy with her work and her achievements.  She plans to expand her coffee plantings, due to the great demand in the area.
Right now, she is more focused on her moto-taxis, since her plantings were already tended to and she is patiently awaiting the harvest.  This will be the Hilda's first loan from MFP, thanks to their help.  She promises to be punctual in her monthly payments.  She belongs to the communal bank “Puente Centenario” (100-year Old Bridge).  She feels comfortable with and excited about the work they are doing.  Once she receives her loan, she will invest in a technical inspection of her vehicles, in registering with the municipality so she can work officially and in changing the headlights and other accessories.

loans.use: to provide technical maintenance for her motorcycles, to update her vehicle registration and to purchase headlights.

loans.name: Susana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Susana tiene 22 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, su casa esta ubicada en el Caserío Colera Distrito de Tambo grande Provincia de Piura la cual se encuentra a 3 horas aproximadamente de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. Susana cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres en sus actividades económicas que realiza diariamente,  su madre quien también se compromete con el crédito desea participar del mismo con su firma en calidad de Aval.

Susana tiene como actividad económica la crianza de aves de corral, específicamente pavos, los cuales son criados y engordados con el fin de ser comercializarlos en el mercado la zona en la que residen, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y bodoques en su domicilio donde atiende de Lunes a Viernes contando ya con una clientela la cual ha sido generada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos, su madre quien participa en el crédito como su Aval  se dedica a la agricultura, venta de comida y golosinas en el colegio del  Caserío Colera. Existe muy buena relación familiar y sobretodo un muy buen conocimiento sobre sus negocios en los cuales están bien establecidas sus metas para seguir creciendo en el negocio.
 
Susana desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales de corral y a la vez mercadería con lo cual incrementara su negocio de venta de gaseosas, la inversión ha sido uno de sus objetivos debido a que considera que tiene demanda suficiente por satisfacer, por lo que solicita crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles

Susana es una persona muy considerada y admirada por los vecinos del lugar donde vive junto a sus padres y demás hermanos.
texts.en:
Susana, age 22, is single and does not have children.  She lives in her parents’ house, which is in the Colera settlement, Tambo Grande district, Piura province.  It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Susana’s parents help her with her daily business activities.  Her mother, who also pledges with the loan, wishes to participate by signing as her guarantor.

Susana raises poultry, specifically turkeys.  She raises them and fattens them in order to sell them at the market in the area where they live.  She also sells soft drinks and snacks at her home.  She tends to this business Monday through Friday.  She has established customers because of her good attention and the good quality of her products.

Her mother, who participates in the loan as her guarantor, devotes herself to farming and to selling food and sweets at the school in the Colera village.  The family relationship is very good, and there exists very good knowledge about the businesses in which they are well-establishes.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

Susana wants to buy balanced feed to fatten her poultry.  She will also buy merchandise to increase her business of selling soft drinks.  The investment has been one of her objectives because she feels that she has plenty of demand to meet.  That is why she is requesting a loan for 800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Susana is a very considerate woman who is admired by her neighbors.  She lives with her parents and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and to stock her store with products.

loans.name: Kerly  Tatiana

texts.es:
Kerly es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, quienes actualmente se dedican a la venta de ganado menor y a la agricultura, anteriormente ellos han sido clientes de Edpyme Alternativa obteniendo un muy buen comportamiento de pago, la casa en la que viven está ubicada en el Caserío rural Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 140 del Dist. Tambogrande, distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Kerly se dedica de lunes a viernes a la venta de productos por catálogo de la línea UNIQUE, con 2 años de experiencia y con clientela ya establecida en la zona, realiza 2 campañas por mes y cada campaña es de 700.00. Nuevos Soles. Debido a que son una familia muy unida sus padres la apoyan en todas sus actividades, su madre quien firma en calidad de aval en el presente crédito asume el mismo compromiso que Kerly. 

Kerly debido al empeño con el que trabaja día a día se ha dado cuenta que su cartera de clientes ah aumentado considerablemente por lo que desea invertir en mencionado negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de  1500 Nuevos Soles. 

Kerly y sus padres son personas muy admiradas y respetadas en el caserío en el que viven por su buena relación familiar y por ser muy trabajadores.
texts.en:
Kerly is a hard working young woman of 21 years.  She is single and has no children.  Kerly lives with her parents, who work in livestock and agriculture, and also used to be members of the communal bank Edpyme Alternative, where they complied with all the loan payments.   Their home is located in an area called Caserio Las Monicas, in the district of Tambogrande, about 3 hours outside the city of Chiclayo.  

For two years, Kerly has worked Monday through Friday selling beauty products for the line Unique, and she now has experience and an established customer base.   Her family is very close, and her parents help her in all her activities.  Her mother has cosigned with Lorena on the loan to invest in her business.  

Kerly's dedication to her work has helped her establish her customer base and grow her business considerably.  This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase more beauty products to sell.    Kerly and her parents are well respected people in their community.  They are known for being a close family and working hard.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad muy responsable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores de edad en una casa que han podido construir con mucho esfuerzo, la casa en la que viven esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Huascar, el mismo que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande , perteneciente al provincia de Piura la cual esta a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Su actividad económica principal de Eugenio es la crianza y posterior comercialización de  ganado ovino, ha dicha actividad se dedica un aproximado de 10 años para lo que ya tiene sus clientes estables que continuamente realizan sus pedido, adicionalmente se genera otros ingresos dedicándose a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con una has de terreno heredada de su padre y en la que actualmente ha sembrado Limón, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral ambos se apoyan para generar ingresos y el sustento debido de la familia para lo que existe una buena relación entres esposo e hijos.
 
Eugenio desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, y por ende ponerlos a mejor precio, además para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de deshierbo con lo que podrá obtener una mejor producción, para lo que a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 800 Nuevos Soles que serán suficientes para atender sus necesidades.

Eugenio, esposa e hijos son personas muy responsables por lo que sus vecinos los respetan y consideran bastante.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 41, is a very responsible and hardworking father.  He lives with his wife and two minor children in a house they managed to build with great effort.  The house they live in is located in a hamlet called Huascar, in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura, which is approximately three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Eugenio's main economic activity is raising and then selling sheep.  He has worked approximately ten years in this job, so he already has regular customers who continually place orders.  Additionally, he generates other income working in agriculture, for which he has a plot of land inherited from his father on which he currently has planted limes.  His wife works raising fowl.  Both support each other to generate income and sustenance for the family, for which there is a good relationship between the couple and their children.
 
Eugenio wants to buy balanced feed to fatten sheep and, consequently, sell them at a better price.  He also wants to buy fertilizer to grow limes and to do  weeding labor so he will be able to get better yields.  This is why he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 800 PEN, which will be enough to take care of his necessities.

Eugenio, his wife, and his children are very responsible people, for which their neighbors respect and think highly of them.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten sheep and fertilizer to grow limes.

loans.name: Oscar Leonidas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Oscar Leonidas; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una empresa pública, el socio también se dedica al negocio de venta de calzados tanto para mujeres y varones, el vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este trabajo y negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar calzados al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “ATIPAY”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the Cusco province and department of Cusco.

This is Oscar Leonidas.  He is 35 years old, married, and has one son.  He alternates his daily activities with working in a public business and selling shoes, both for women and men.  He is an ambulatory salesman.  Through this work, he is able to move forward for his son.  His dream is to have his own space where he can sell shoes.  He requests a loan to buy shoes wholesale.

This partner is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children, and only one child goes to school. She takes care of four additional family members (grandchildren). She sells fabric printed with colorful patterns (bitenge) on a retail basis. She sells her products from home. She works six days a week, and she has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bitenge (African fabrics). Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to get a shop where she can sell her clothes and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more coloured fabrics (African bitenge).

loans.name: Zani

texts.en: Zani is married and the father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He earns a living by selling goat meat to people who live in his area.  His main challenges are the high cost of food and the death of livestock from disease. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Zani is applying for a loan for Kes 30,000 to buy more goats. His goal is to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu as a way to reach that goal.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay is 56 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last 12 years, he has earned a living by running a store where he sells flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, candies and other items. His store is in a good location and he has a deep knowledge of the market and the needs of his customers. He earns about 200 AZN a month, and gets help from his wife, who buys many of the products he sells and brings them to the shop. He is applying for a loan for 2,000 AZN to buy more food products to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 39 years old, married, and blessed with two children, aged seven and three years. He is a shoe shiner and owns a grocery shop, a business he started seven years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase shoe polish, dye, brushes, thread, and leather. Profits from his business will boost his business. 

His dream is to see his business expand and to build rental houses in a plot. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoe polish, dye, brushes, thread, and leather.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is 23 years old and lives in the Airport community. She has two children, aged 2 months and 5 years, one of whom is in school and both of whom live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling alcoholics drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholics drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks for her business.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Canto Grande Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mariella, es divorciada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 son independientes y 1 dependiente. Es socia nueva de Edaprospo, ya que es la primera vez que el grupo solicita un crédito a la entidad. Su negocio trata de una salón de belleza en donde ella ofrece el servicio de cosmetología. Tiene 4 años en este rubro, ya que anteriormente tenía un restaurante. Comenzó con la venta de dulces y caramelos, luego con la venta de productos de belleza como Avon y Unique. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abrir su salón de belleza. Actualmente ella cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un nuevo restaurante. Ella usará el reciente préstamo en la compra de nuevos accesorios para su salón de belleza. La alcancía comunal se llama “Las Triunfadoras de Canto Grande” el cual está conformado por 7 personas.
texts.en: 52-year-old Mariella is divorced and has six children.  Five of her children live independently and one is still dependent on her.  She is a new member of Edaprospo and this is the first time that her group have requested a loan from the institution.  Mariella's business is a beauty salon, where she offers cosmetology services.  She has been in this line of work for four years.  Before that she ran a restaurant.  She started out selling sweet treats and candies then beauty products from Avon and Unique.  Through her hard work, she managed to open a beauty salon.  She currently covers her food expenses and bills.  Her plan for the future is to open a new restaurant.  She will use this loan to buy new accessories for her beauty salon.  The community bank is called 'Las Triunfadoras de Canto Grande' and it has seven members.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad muy responsable y respetuoso, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, tienen una casa en la que viven en un caserío de nombre “Guaraguaos Alto 57”,  es un caserío rural que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande y el que pertenece a la provincia de Piura la misma que se encuentra a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la zona en la que vive Carlos es una zona en la que tienen como actividad económica principal la agricultura y ganadería, por ser zonas rurales no cuentan aun con servicios básicos.

Carlos se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como: ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, ah mencionada actividad se viene dedicando ya aproximadamente 4 años, adicionalmente se genera ingresos trabajando como obrero en una empresa de nombre SISA y es su esposa e hijos quienes apoyan en la crianza de los animales a cargo.

Carlos desea mejorar la calidad de su negocio por lo que desea comprar alimentos balanceados para la crianza y engorde de sus animales hasta que alcancen su peso y tamaño ideal para su mejor comercialización, por que ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 600 Nuevos Soles con los que atenderá sus necesidades y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carlos su esposa y sus hijos son personas de buen carácter, nobles y trabajadores por lo que son bien considerados por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 49, is a very responsible, respectful father who lives with his wife and four children.  They have a house in a rural community called "Guaraguaos Alto 57", which belongs to the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is about three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  In the area where Carlos lives most of the business activity is agriculture and livestock farming because it is a rural community that still only has basic services.

Carlos works every day raising livestock such as cattle, sheep, ducks, turkeys and guinea pigs, among other animals.  He has been able to set up strategic spaces around his house to raise the animals and has been in business for approximately four years.  He also earns an income working for a company called SISA.  His wife and children help out with the livestock.

In an effort to improve the quality of his business, Carlos wants to buy balanced feed for his livestock so they can reach the ideal weight and size to sell them better.  He has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,300 PEN to attend to his needs and improve his lifestyle.

Carlos, as well as his wife and children, are kind, noble, hard-working people who are held in high esteem by their neighbors.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to raise livestock.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (mother and sister). She sells sweet bananas at the market on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from working as a sweeper with the Kampala Capital City Authority (KCCA) . She works seven days a week, and she has been in this business for the last 7 years. She has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build a house and also to start going to villages for sweet bananas. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a married man. He has 2 children, aged 6 years and 12 years. He is a social man. He operates a retail stall where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for expanding his tire retail store. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase tires to sell. Jeremiah's  business goal is to be a major supplier of tires in his home town within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will own a big tire shop.

loans.use: to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 58 years old and lives in Migori, West Kenya with his wife and five children, who range in age from 13 to 22 years old. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by making bricks and now earns about KES 7,000 a month. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy the raw materials he needs to make bricks. He will use profits made possible by this loan to educate children. His dream is to have a stable, successful business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a brick-making business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia de 62 años está casada con Elías con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de ellos que tiene 19 años de edad. Ella, su esposo y su hijo viven juntos en una casa propia en el distrito San Ramón, provincia de Chanchamayo. Incansable y llena de energías, Aurelia comenta que inició sus actividades económicas desde jovencita. Ahora que ya cuenta con 62 años se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio que instaló en su propia casa, ahí vende golosinas, gaseosas, comestibles y bebidas heladas.
En las tardes prepara sándwich y anticuchos. Lleva como 30 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Como en todo negocio siempre tiene días donde las ventas disminuyen, por ejemplo en los meses de enero y febrero, pero cuando las clases se inician, la concurrencia de gente aumenta y por lo tanto sus ventas aumentan.
Elías es un hombre que trabajó arduamente en sus años de joven. Ahora recibe su jubilación y puede vivir tranquilo. Así convive esta familia, que anhela ampliar su negocio, comprando más mercadería para abastecer a su exigente clientela. Sería la primera vez que Aurelia accedería a un préstamo de MFP, se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. También menciona sentirse contenta de pertenecer a su reciente banco comunal “Puente centenario”.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir más mercadería como: gaseosas, golosinas, cajones o jabas de frutas e insumos para preparar los sándwich.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 62 years old and is married to Elías, with whom she has 6 children.  Only the youngest still lives with them; he is 19 years old.  Aurelia, her husband and their son live together in their own home in the San Ramón District of Chanchamayo Province.  Tireless and full of energy, Aurelia says that she started her businesses as a young woman.  Now that she is 62 years old, she makes her living with a small business run out of her home.  There, she sells sweets, sodas, foodstuffs and cold beverages.
In the afternoons, she makes sandwiches and kebabs.  She has been operating this business for about 30 years, and it is going very well for her.  As with all businesses, there are always times when sales go down, for example in the months of January and February.  But when classes start up again, the concurrence of people increases, and with that her sales increase.
Elías is a man who worked hard in his younger years.  He now receives retirement and can live peacefully.  That is how this family lives.  Aurelia hopes to expand her business, to purchase more merchandise to supply her demanding clientele.  This is the first time Aurelia will access a loan from MFP.  She promises to be punctual in the re-payment of her loan.  She also says that she feels happy to belong to her recent communal bank “Puente Centenario” (100-year Old Bridge).
With the money, Aurelia will be able to acquire more merchandise, such as sodas, sweets, boxes or crates of fruit and sandwich-maknig supplies.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, sweets, boxes or crates of fruit and sandwich-making supplies.

loans.name: Rudia

texts.en: Rudia is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children who range in age from 6 to 16 years old. She describes herself as decisive and very focused on her business, a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as onions, kale and tomatoes. She has been in this line of work for two years and has a great location which allows her to sell a lot of produce to people in her area. She also sells milk as a way to increase her income. Her biggest challenge is a shortage of money, which is why she is applying for a loan for KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables to sell. Her goal is to open a wholesale grocery store within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jesus Enrique

texts.es: Jesus, es un joven trabajador de 22 años que vive en la ciudad de Monterrey. Es empleado de una empresa en la cual tiene 2 años laborando, su sueño es emprender un negocio de comidas para darle trabajo a su madre y esposa ya que ellas estaran a cargo de atenderlo, para él seguir con su empleo actual y así poder tener ingresos extras.
texts.en: Jesus is a hard-working young man, 22 years old, who lives in the city of Monterrey. He is an employee of a business where he has worked for 2 years. His dream is to set up a food business, so he can provide work for his mother and his wife, since they would be in charge of running it, so that he can continue with his current work and thus have additional income.

loans.use: to set up a food business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casado,  vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como el abono y otros químicos para asistir su cafetal de buena forma. El tiene como meta darle a su cafetal las máximas y mejores condiciones de producción para así tener un mejor rendimiento en producción. El espera generar las mayores de las ganancias para así ayudarle a su padres con las cosas del hogar y llegar a tener una estabilidad económica mejor para su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos is 29 years old.  He is married and currently lives with his parents and siblings.  He will use this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and other chemicals to help get his coffee plantation in good shape.  His goal is to give his coffee plantation the best and greatest production conditions in order to produce a better yield.  He hopes to make the highest possible earnings so he can help his parents with things for the house and achieve better financial stability for his future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had never taken out other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and other chemicals to help get his coffee plantation in good shape.

loans.name: Bugambilias Group

texts.es:
Las Bugambilias son un grupo solidario de Credituyo que está en su primer ciclo con esta institución. Ellas escogieron este nombre porque les gusta mucho esta planta y las flores que dan. Ellas son 8 mujeres trabajadoras que viven en el municipio de García, al norte de Monterrey. Ellas dicen ser un grupo muy solidario.

Areli Yedid es una de las mujeres del grupo. Areli tiene 30 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estan asistiendo a la escuela actualmente, uno de 11 años y una de 8, el pequeño apenas tiene 4 años y acaba de entrar al jardin de niños. 

Areli se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, blancos y algunos muebles de madera. Ella empezo su negocio hace cuatro años con el objetivo de poder proveerle a sus hijos del mejor futuro posible.   Comenzó vendiendo productos sólo a sus familiares y amigos cercanos y poco a poco ella ha ido comenzando a venderle a los vecinos de la colonia. Con la ayuda de este crédito ella espera poder a establecer diferentes rutas de ventas por varias colonias y asi lograr que su negocio continue creciendo. Ella quiere usar este crédito para comprar más sábanas y aparatos electrodomésticos que son los productos que más se le están vendiendo ahorita y se le hace que podría empezar a vender en otras colonias.
texts.en:
Las Bugambilias [The Bougainvilleas] is a Credituyo solidarity group. They are currently requesting their first loan with this institution. The women chose this name because they really like this plant and it's flowers. They are eight hard working women that live in the Garcia municipality, north of Monterrey. They say it is a very united group.

Areli Yedid is one of the women in the group. Areli is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Two of the children are currently in school. One is eleven years old and another is eight years old, while the smallest has just turn four and entered preschool. 

Areli makes a living selling household appliances, linens, and some wood furniture. She began the business four years ago with the goal of being able to provide the best future possible for her children. She began by selling products just to her family members and close friends. Little by little she has begun to make sales to her neighbors in the community.

With the help from this loan she hopes to be able to establish different sales routes in several neighborhoods. This way her business will continue growing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bed sheets and household appliances which are the best selling products right now. This will allow her to be able to make her sales in other neighborhoods.

loans.use: to buy more sheets and electronic appliances to have greater merchandise variety.

loans.name: Carmen Rosalinda

texts.es:
Carmen tiene un pequeño de 5 años al cual cría sola, esto se debe a que el padre de su pequeño decidió abandonarla, cuando sucedió esto ella decidió hacer hasta lo imposible para sacar a su pequeño adelante y lograr que ambos pudieran llevar una vida llena de felicidad y sobre todo juntos. Actualmente su hijito va a educación Inicial y ella está muy contenta por lograr  que su pequeño empiece a desarrollarse educativamente.
 
Para poder salir adelante ella se dedica a trabajar desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche en varios distritos de la ciudad de Chincha, tiempo en el que atiende a 15 clientes, ella trabaja como consultora de productos de belleza, es un negocio que le está resultando rentable y confía mucho en que podrá hacer una línea de carrera en la empresa en donde trabaja. Carmen sabe que está ganando muchos clientes por el buen trato que les brinda a sus clientes, su actitud positiva y su pasión por dedicarse de lleno a estos productos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, esta humilde mujer podrá incrementar su mercadería (Perfumes, Cremas, Collares, etc) y aprovechas ofertas de mercadería al por mayor, lo mismo que le permitirá vender sus productos y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia. Desea poder seguir desarrollando como consultora y continuar ascendiendo con la finalidad de convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y lograr distribuir mayores productos.
texts.en:
Carmen has a little one who is 5 years old and who she is raising alone.  This is because her little one's father decided to abandon her.  When that happened, Carmen decided to do whatever it would take to give her son a future and to help them both live a happy life most importantly, together.  Currently, her little son has started school, and Carmen feels feels happy to have been able to help her little one start his educational development.
 
In order to get ahead, Carmen makes her living working from 9:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night in the various districts in the city of Chincha.  During this time, she sees about 15 customers.  Carmen works as a beauty products consultant.  It's a business that has been profitable for her, and she is very confident that she will be able to follow a career path with the company she works for.  Carmen knows that she is gaining a lot of customers because of the good service she offers, her positive attitude and her passion for standing behind the product completely.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, this humble woman will be able to increase her merchandise, (perfumes, lotions, necklaces etc.) and take advantage of wholesale merchandise sales, which will also allow her to sell her products at a better profit margin.  Carmen hopes to be able to keep developing as a consultant, to continue rising with the goal of becoming a successful business woman and to distribute a greater amount of product.

loans.use: to purchase sale merchandise (perfumes, lotions, necklaces etc.).

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Maricela es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace dos años  ella  nos cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias y así puede ayudar a su familia.
Tambien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de arreglos para fiestas y arreglos para aginandos infantiles.
Esta  felizmente  casada  con  el señor Rubén con quien tiene un hijo a quien quiere mucho y desea darle la mejor educación .
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas zapatos para la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricela is a hardworking woman who has sold shoes for two years. She says that she enjoys her business very much because she gets good income and is able to help her family.
She also makes and sells decorations for parties and children's celebrations.
She is happily married to Mr. Rubén, they have a son, she loves him very much and wishes to give him the best education possible.
Mrs. Maricela needs the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: buy more shoes to sell/souvenirs

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
La señora María Leticia es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  zapatos desde hace dos años.
También se dedica a la venta de comida como son: caldo de res ,caldo de pollo y mole de pollo.
Esta felizmente casada con la señor Ireneo un señor trabajador que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace dos años.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas zapatos para la venta .
Le da las gracias por ayudarla para que su negocio crezca cada día mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Leticia is a hardworking woman who has sold shoes for about two years.
She also sells food like beef and chicken soup as well as chicken mole (a type of chili sauce).
Mrs. María Leticia is happily married to Mr. Ireneo, a hardworking man who has worked as a mason for two years.
She needs the loan to buy more shoes to sell.
Mrs. María Leticia is grateful to the foundation for helping her business grow more each day.

loans.use: buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto, de 50 años es un hombre de trabajo y de mucha responsabilidad por el bienestar de su esposa y de sus 04 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa a base de material noble. Jacinto, es un agricultor, desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron sobre la siembra y cosecha de cacao, coca y café. Ahora que tiene familia se dedica a sus cultivos que con gran esfuerzo logró obtener. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con la ayuda de jornales que logran extraer los frutos de forma rápida; después los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio de la localidad de Palmapampa, donde le ofrecen buenos precios por cada kilogramo. Sin embargo su dificultad es no poder combatir con las plagas que aquejan sus sembríos; pero él no se da por vencido y sigue adelante dando el mejor cuidado para obtener una buena producción.  Su mayor anhelo es seguir sembrando sus plantas y de esa forma  con las ganancias ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, agradece por la confianza que le dan así como él se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es un socio solidario.  Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos agroquímicos para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Jacinto, 50 years old, is a hardworking man, responsible for the well being of his wife and 4 children.  They live together in their own home made of noble material.  Jacinto is a farmer.  Ever since he was very young, his parents taught him about planting and harvesting cacao, coca, and coffee.  Now that he has a family of his own, he dedicates himself to his crops, which he was able to obtain with a lot of hard work.  During harvest time, he counts on the help of day laborers who help pick fruit rapidly.  Later he takes them to sell at collection centers in Palmapampa, where they offer good prices for each kilogram.  However, the difficulty lies in combating the pests that afflict the crop.  He doesn’t give up and continues on giving the best care to get the best production.  His greatest hope is to keep planting his crops and in this way, be able to offer his children a good education.  This will be his 4th loan with MFP.  He is grateful for their trust in him, and he promises to be punctual with his payments.  In his communal bank he is a single partner.  With 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy agrochemical products to maintain his crops.

loans.use: buy agrochemical products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora  Rosalina  es una  señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas  para la venta.
Esta felizmente casada con la señor Rene un señor trabajador con quien  dos hijos por quien los dos trabajan para darles un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas   lechos y  maíz para la  elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias afundacion por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking woman who makes a living making tortillas to sell.

She is happily married to Rene, a hardworking man with whom she has two children. They both work to give their children a better future.

She asked for the loan to buy more logs and corn to make tortillas.

She is thankful to the foundation for their support.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas.

loans.name: Severa

texts.es:
La señora severa es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora cuenta con 53 años de edad y está casada con el señor santana quien es campesino, tienen 2 hijos los cuales ya están casados y cada quien tiene su propia familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos , desde hace mas de 20 años.

Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también así poder contar con una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de leche, sal y cuajo.

Una de las metas que tiene doña severa para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante ampliar un poco su local, ya que quiere comprar más tinas, bandejas, coladoras y charolas para agilizar su producción, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.

Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá de mucho puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Severa is a very enterprising, hard working woman.  She’s 53 years old and married to Santana who is a farmer.  They have two children who are already married and have their own families.  She has been making cheese to sell for more than 20 years.

She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wants to help her husband with household expenses since he works too much and does not earn enough to have good economic solvency.  Also, she can have better quality of life.  The loan she got will be used to buy milk, salt and rennet.

One of the goals Severa has for her business is to make it grow very much because she’s thinking later on to enlarge her locale a bit because she wants to buy more tubs, trays, strainers and trays to ease production because that way she will improve and increase income much more.

She thanks Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all the support and trust they are giving her because this will help her quite a bit because now she can continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt and rennet.

loans.name: Leandro Martín

texts.es: Leandro es un joven que está estudiando la carrera de Ingenriería de Sistemas, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Tiene un cyber el cual es administrado por él, y de esta manera ha podido costear sus estudios. Quiere triunfar en la vida, tener un buen trabajo y ayudar a su familia. Su mayor inspiración es su madre por el esfuerzo que ha hecho para que él pudiera salir adelante, también le inspira el hecho de poder llegar a ser una persona importante en su comunidad.
texts.en: Leandro is a young Systems Engineering student.  He has an Internet-leasing business that covers some of his college costs, but he needs a loan to pay for what the business doesn't cover.  He wants to make a success of his life, to have a good job and help his family.  His greatest inspiration is his mother.  She has worked hard to make sure that he has a good chance to succeed in the world and become an important member of his community.

loans.use: to pay college costs.

loans.name: Petronila Margarita

texts.es: Petronila trabaja en un instituto como maestra, está por finalizar su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación y obtener su título. Sus sueños son poder montar una empresa y también desea seguir preparándose académicamente mejor. Porque de esa manera mirará todo el esfuerzo que le dedicó a los estudios todos éstos años para ser una buena profesional y ayudarle a su familia.
texts.en: Petronila works as a teacher in a school.  She is about to finish her degree in Systems Engineering and is requesting a loan so that she can pay for her degree certification course and obtain her degree.  Her dream is to set up a business and she would also like to continue improving herself academically.  This will justify all the hard work that she put into her studies over the years so that she could become a good professional and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her degree certification course

loans.name: Delma Rosa

texts.es: Delma es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, es casada, y junto a su familia desea poder salir adelante. El crédito solicitado es para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Sus planes son poder al fin coronar su carrera y poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en una empresa que solicite sus servicios, espera poder ayudar a su familia y tener un propósito en la vida. Tuve dificultades económicas a lo largo de todo el periodo de sus estudios, pero pudo superarlos y salir adelante.
texts.en: Delma is a young student in the field of Systems Engineering. She is married and wishes, along with her family, to be able to get ahead. The requested loan is for paying for the final stages of the degree program in her field. Her plans are to be able finally to cap off her degree and put into practice the knowledge she has acquired in some business which may seek her services. She hopes to be able to help her family and have a purpose in life. She had financial difficulties throughout the entire period of her coursework, but was able to overcome them and continue forward.

loans.use: to pay for the completion of her degree program.

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es: El señor José, es habitante del municipio de la CONCEPCION. Es agricultor y se dedica al cultivo de piña. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para abonar la tierra y atacar las plagas que constantemente están atacando sus cultivos. También utilizará el crédito para comprar materiales para sembrar 1/4 de manzana de piña y así aumentar su producción y los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his family in the town of La Concepcion. He works in agriculture growing pineapple. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to fertilize the ground and combat the plagues that are constantly threatening his crop. He will also use the loan to plant a quarter "manzana" (approx. 0.42 acres*) with pineappleto increase his production and income for his family. 

*(one manzana = 1.68 acres)

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock and expand her mini-market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mrimo Group

texts.en:
This group is called MRIMO. It consists of seven members:  Khadijah, Hana, Hiah, Nwal, Shmah, Shfigah and Hiam who are mainly married women and average 28- 40 years of age with two to five children each. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of this group are very trustworthy, responsible, hard workers. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have so many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 330,000 YER.

Hiam is the group leader, 46 years old and a widow (she is on the right side holding a red and white dress in the photo). She has two children; the older is 5 years old and the younger is 3 and they live in Sana`a. Hiam has been operating a  sewing business for over five years. 

She chose this business because she loved it since childhood. She started to study to be a tailor in a sewing institute thus she developed her business by dealings with traders who support her to buy patterns of fabric and robes for stitching. 

Because she is a professional in stitching, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to grow her business and attract  more customers. 

In the future, she dreams of saving money in order to purchase more machines to ensure that she can continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to grow her business and attract  more customers.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Ghada is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do house maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living condtions.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is a married man. He has two children and one is enrolled in school. Wallace operates a motor vehicle transport business. He's worked in this business for five years. His primary customers are local area residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be rising prices of fuel and his highest monthly expenses are for food and house rent. He rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Wallace will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle. Wallace aspires to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children; all of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Regina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is a 56-year-old man, married with three children.  He sells food products as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Nadir has 12 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food product he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Nadir would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will  diversify and purchase additional foodstuffs. He has a positive loan history and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Sana'a refused to have her picture uploaded on the internet; instead the man in the photo is her husband Tamer

Sana’a is a 20-year-old married lady from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Sana’a is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to do house maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family living conditions and raising their living standard.

loans.use: to do house maintenance.

loans.name: Aliah

texts.en:
Aliah is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Aliah is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do house maintenance.

loans.name: Doa'a

texts.en:
Doa'a is a 20-year-old lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Doa'a is an ambitious lady thus she started her own business selling clothes from home. She is requesting a youth loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more quantities for trading purposes. 

Doa'a is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trading purposes

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que le parece el servicio que ha recibido y además que con estos préstamos logra realizar lo que con su ingreso normal no puede cubrir. Él comprara postes de energía eléctrica y cables con ellos instalara la energía de calle, para mantener alumbrado su patio y calle, evitando cualquier riesgo delincuencial.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con su préstamo anterior, mejorando su negocio y las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José has decided to apply for a new loan, because he likes the service he has received.  Also, with these loans he is managing to do what he can't pay for with his normal income. 

He will buy power poles and cable for bringing power in from the street, so that he can keep his patio and driveway lit, avoiding any risk of crime. 

He had a positive experience with the previous loan; improving his business, and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy power poles and cable.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 37-year-old man from Kakamega town, in the west of Kenya and is married to Niver. They have  three children  aged 11, eight and four years.

John operates a cereal sales business, a business he has done for the last 14 years, making a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more maize and beans. His profits will be used to buy more cereals.

His dream is to always have a stable quantity of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize and beans.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children; four of them are in school. She has had a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for five years.

Sabina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Heba rejected having her picture uploaded on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband Lo'ai.

Heba is a 23-year-old married lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children. Heba has a home-based business through which she helps her husband by selling baby's diapers. She is requesting a youth loan of 1,200 JD to purchase more goods so that her husband can distribute the diapers via his bus.

Heba is looking to purchase a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as baby diapers to sell

loans.name: Doa'a

texts.en:
Doa'a is a 20-year-old single lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Doa'a is trading in cosmetics and perfumes, thus she is requesting a youth loan of 700 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more cosmetics products. 

Doa'a is looking to open her own shop so that she can increase her income and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Shahrazad

texts.en:
Shahrazad is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of three children. 

Shahrazad is requesting a youth loan of 800 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do home maintenance and purchase appliances. 

Shahrazad is looking to improve her family's living conditions and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Baha'a Al Dein

texts.en:
Baha'a Al Dein is a 20-year-old single man from Sahab, Jordan.

Baha'a Al Dein has his own barbershop and he is requesting a youth loan of 1500 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed for the barber shop.

Baha'a Al Dein is looking to expand his business and increase his income so that he can  improve his family's living standards and improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines needed for the barber shop.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en: Qamar is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, and she is the mother of three children. She sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a youth loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase more clothes. Qamar is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 2 children, ages 8 and 4, both of whom go to school. 

Cristina runs a small tea business and she has been in the business for 3 years. She has 1 employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more food items like sugar, tea leaves and many others. Cristina has no other source of income in addition to this business. 

In 5 years time, she would like to hope for a big set up restaurant. 	Her major challenges include home expenses because of the high standard of living in Juba.  She says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like sugar, tea leaves and many others.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  is 32 years old, lives in Airport community, and    she has a ten-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past  six  years, she has been selling "red oil" (palm oil) in the market, She is requesting a loan to purchase more "red oil" for her business. Her plan is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues Rana was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the Internet so the man in the photo is Rana's brother.

Rana is a 24-year-old divorced woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Rana has a beauty salon and she is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed for the salon. Rana is looking to purchase her own car.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines for her salon.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 23-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of one child.

Yasmeen sells clothes and she is working from home. She is requesting a youth loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Yasmeen is looking to have her own shop and  a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a married man. He has 1 child who is enrolled in school. Dennis operates a retail shop. He's worked in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are the local area residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, detergents and cooking oil for resale. He aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, detergents and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages three and one. She has a boutique business she started three years ago and she earns an income of about KES 20,000 per month. 

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 which she will use to purchase cosmetics, jeans, trousers and sweaters to sell. The anticipated profit will help her expand her business.
