The group's members are all friends and neighbors from this city who see Fundación Paraguaya as a great help for themselves and their families.  They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial people who work hard to provide their families with the best, so that they don't have to want for anything.

Ana is the group's president.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who is capable of leading a large group such as this one.  During all her loan cycles, she has demonstrated a desire to do well.  She tells us that she sells general merchandise.  She has a store where she sells all kinds of items such as clothing, books, exercise books, shoes, etc.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to do well and help her family.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy clothes, shoes, books, exercise books, pencils and other items with which to stock her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes, pencils, exercise books and other items

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El señor Eulogio, tiene ingresos que recibe de la renta cada mes.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar un tratamiento médico el cual no cubre su seguro.
Eulogio es viudo y tiene una hija con la cual vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La  Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Señor Eulogio has income that he receives from rent each month.

He is requesting the loan to pay for medical treatment which his insurance does not cover.

Eulogio is a widower and has one daughter with whom he lives in a paid-for rental in the Sopacachi area of La Paz city.

This is his first time working with IMPRO, and his first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of medical treatment that's not covered by his insurance.

loans.name: Izkra

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa y trae repuestos de autos tambien; La socia continua estudiando turismo y ella misma se mantiene sola. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra y venta de ropa y de repuestos para autos los cuales llevara a la misma comunidad a vender y distrubuir a las tiendas de venta de repuestos para autos.
texts.en:
This member is continuing with her business purchasing and selling clothing, and also auto parts.  The member is continuing to study tourism, and she remains single.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing and auto parts, which she brings to her community to sell and distribute to the stores that sell auto parts.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing clothing and auto parts.

loans.name: Desdemona

texts.en:
Desdemona is 65 years old. She is a widow and lives in the village, Tsikhesulori, in West Georgia with her sister-in-law. Desdemona works as a teacher in the village school. Her sister-in-law is retired. The family has a milk cow. The dairy products are mainly consumed by the family members. They sell the surplus in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris, including Desdemona’s sister-in-law's pension. 

Desdemona has requested credit for the start-up of a new business initiative. She will cultivate family-owned land, and purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds. After proper cultivation and fertilizing of the land, Desdemona will get a high quality harvest and sell it for a convenient price. The income of the family will increase and Desdemona and her sister-in-law will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, and to purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame AWA est née vers 1968, mère de deux enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Niena dans la région de Sikasso.
AWA, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment le commerce de pagnes et des parures, s’est vite initiée aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de céréales (mil, maïs, riz, etc.), il y a environ 4 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, elle jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant 4 ans. Tous les  prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Awa  sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 30 sacs de mil, 1 tonne de maïs et 5 sacs de sorgho. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de : Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala et Niena. Les  céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin à Niena. Ses ventes se font en gros et en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, elle compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. AWA was born in 1968. She lives with her husband and two children in Niena, in the region of Sikasso. 

Having attempted several activities without success, including the sale of pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and jewelry, Awa learned the business of stocking and selling cereals (millet, corn, rice, etc.) about four years ago. Thanks to her experience in this sector, she enjoys a great reputation but lacks the necessary resources to meet customer demand. She decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago, and all past loans have been correctly repaid. 

Eager to satisfy a growing customer base, Awa is now seeking a new loan to purchase 30 sacks de millet, 1 tonne of corn and 5 sacks of sorghum. She buys her merchandise in the villages of Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala and Niena. She stores the cereals in her Niena facility and sells at retail and wholesale to a diverse clientele, mostly for cash but sometimes on credit.

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 CFAF, which she will use to cover the majority of her expenses as well as her family’s, and to pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus 2 hijos, su casa en la que actualmente viven está ubicada en  el  Caserío CP-2 Cólera, Distrito de Tambogrande, distrito que pertenece a la provincia a de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito el cual poco esta progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Santos vive en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera por lo que él no es ajeno a esta actividad siendo su principal actividad económica, Santos cuenta con 4.37 has de terreno agrícola, los cuales están sembrados de limón y de mango de buena calidad, según nos refieren son productos de exportación, a esta actividad se viene dedicando gran parte de su vida debido a que son terrenos heredados de sus padres, y como actividad adicional su esposa apoya a la canasta familiar criando y vendiendo animales de corral, la buena relación que existe entre ellos como familia es que ha generado que siempre se mantengan unidos en sus negocios y sus proyectos de vida.

Santos en vista de que cosecha productos de exportación tiene objetivos claros los cuales están fijados en mejorar mucho mas la calidad de sus productos para obtener mejores mercados, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2300 Nuevos Soles para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sus plantaciones.

Santos y su familia son personas muy respetadas y valoradas por lo mucho que han apoyado a los vecinos del caserío en el que viven.
texts.en:
Santos is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and two children.  The home where they currently live is located in the CP-2 Cólera village, in the district of Tambogrande.  This district is part of the Piura province, which is located about 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.  Santos lives in the rural part of this district; it is progressing somewhat, but for now they they only have basic electrical service.

Santos lives in a distinctly farming and livestock area, which is not foreign to him as this is his principal economic activity.  Santos has 4.37 hectares of farmland where he grows good quality limes and mangoes for export.  He has spent much of his life working in this activity, as he inherited his farmland from his parents.  As an additional activity, his wife helps meet the family's basic needs by raising and selling farmyard animals.  The good relationship that they have between themselves as family has been generated by always maintaining unity in in their businesses and life-projects.

Santos, on seeing his harvest of products for export, has clear objectives which are fixed: to greatly improve the quality of his products to reach better markets.  This is why he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 2,300 new soles for the purchase of fertilizers and manure for his plantations.

Santos and his family are people who are very respected and valued for everything that they have done to help out their neighbors in the village where they live.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his lime and mango plantations.

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Uriel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos como televisores, computadoras y celulares, el vende los artefactos pero algunos son de segunda mano, el tiene una pequeña tienda que queda en su casa, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artefactos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos.
texts.en: Sr. Uriel is 33 years old, married, and has a son. As well as his regular daily activities, he runs a business selling televisions, computers, and cell phones, some of which are secondhand. His small store is located in his house. Uriel wishes to expand and improve his business so he is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase electronics like televisions, computers, and cell phones

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, trabaja como empleada en una fábrica en el área de productos terminados y también vende pantalones por las noches y los fines de semana,  no tiene puesto fijo de venta y por eso ambula por las calles.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más pantalones y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos ya que es una fuente de trabajo para su familia.
Rosmery, es casada y tiene dos hijos viven en la zona Sopocachi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosmery works as an employee for a factory making finished products, and she also sells trousers in the evenings and at weekends.  She has no fixed sales location, and therefore works as a street-vendor.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more trousers; in this way she can improve her income as it is a source of work for her family.

Rosmery is married and has two children.  They live in the Sopocachi area of La Paz city.

This is her second time working with IMPRO and her second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of trousers for retail sale to her customers.

loans.name: Felix Roberto

texts.es: Félix Roberto tiene 58 años de edad, el trabaja en la alcaldía de la localidad ya tiene años de estar trabajando para esa empresa. Félix Roberto con muchos esfuerzos adquirió su casa de habitación donde él quiere realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, y con el poco salario que genera no puede cubrir todas las mejoras de la vivienda que desea realizarle, lo cual está solicitando financiamiento para realizar las mejoras con el crédito compara arena, cemento, piedrín entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Félix Roberto is 58 years old.  He works in his town's town hall.  He's been working for them for years.  With a lot of effort, Felix Roberto acquired his own home and he wants to make some improvements to the dwelling.  But with his small salary, he doesn't earn enough to make the improvements to the dwelling that he wants to.  That is why he is requesting financing, to make the improvements.  With the loan, he will purchase sand, cement, gravel and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel and other construction materials.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en:
Chinh is 35 years old and has two school-aged children. She runs a small grocery shop that opened 12 years ago. 

Chinh is requesting a loan for 9,184,000 VND to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers. She joined SEDA in 2008 and used loans for expanding her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products.

loans.name: Sall

texts.en:
Sall is 43 years old, married to a teacher, and has five children who attend school. She runs a salon business, which she has been doing for 15 years.

Sall is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more salon products such as shampoo and hair conditioner. She says that the profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase salon products such as shampoo and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Virgen De La O Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

Higidia tiene 56 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la venta de choclo los cuales lleva a Juliaca y también se dedica  a la venta de ganado, la venta de ganado le realiza en las distintas ferias que existe en la feria en distrito de Yucay, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganado y venta de choclos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar choclos y alimentos para los ganados. 


 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, venta de verduras, venta de ganados, venta de maíz, materiales de construcción, tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the Virgen de la O Community Bank located in Yucay District, Urubamba Province in the department of Cusco.

56-year old Higidia is married and has six children. She earns her living by selling sweetcorn in Juliaca. She also sells livestock in various markets around the district. Her dream is to expand her livestock and sweetcorn businesses so she is seeking a loan to buy more maize and also feed for her animals.

The other members have businesses such as selling shoes, vegetables, livestock, maize, construction materials, and one has a grocery store.

Higidia is grateful to those who are helping her to achieve her dream and promises to make the loan repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy maize and also feed for her animals

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is a widow and she has two children. She is 52 years old. She sells clothes. Vestine has been selling clothes for 6 years. With the loan, she hopes to buy larger quantities and different types of clothes, including bitenge (African fashion for ladies), to sell. She believes she will use the profits from the business to provide food for the family and to make savings. She aims high for the future and she believes she will make it possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita lives in Air port Community. She is 23 years old, single, and has two children between the ages of 9 months and 6 years old. She stopped her education in the 10th grade. For the past twelve years she has been selling charcoal in her community. Anita says she spends most of her time with her business since her business helps to sustain them. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kimi

texts.es:
Kimi, de 27 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora, es madre soltera de dos niños, Oscar de 5 años y Lionel de 2 años a quienes cría sola debido a que se separó de su pareja. Ella vive en su casa propia a lado de sus dos niños por quienes desea trabajar mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Kimi, de dedica a la venta de productos de bella, cosmético y perfumería, lleva realizando por 2 años este trabajo, que le permite poder ayudar a las demás mujeres a sentirse mas bellas y seguras de lo que son. En su casa tiene una pequeña vitrina en donde exhibe sus productos y espera a que sus clientes vayan a comprarle, cuando tiene muchos productos en stock se va a las casa de sus clientes y ofrece siempre con una sonrisa y ofreciendo la manera de pago que mejor le conviene al cliente.
Trabaja sola ya que se siente cómoda así y eso le permite tener mas ingresos, además de poder tener tiempo para poder estar a lado de sus menores hijos quienes a su edad necesitan mucho de sus cuidados. Espera poder seguir haciendo feliz y brindando esa seguridad de sentirse bellas a las personas, y mas adelante le gustaría tener un local en donde pueda ofrecer otro tipo de productos más. Este será el crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas productos de belleza, cosméticos y perfumes para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kimi, aged 27, is a friendly and enterprising woman.  She is the single mother of two children: Oscar, aged 5, and Lionel, aged 2, whom she is raising alone due to separating from her partner.  She lives in her own home with her two children, for whom she wants to work a lot so as to be able to provide them with a better quality of life.

Kimi works selling beauty products: cosmetics and perfume.  She has been doing this work for two years, and it allows her to be able to help other women feel more beautiful and confident in who they are.  She has a small display cabinet in her home where she displays her products, and hopes that her customers will come to purchase them.  She has many products in stock, and goes to the homes of her customers.  She always sells with a smile, and offers the means of payment that is most convenient for her customers.

She works on her own as she feels comfortable doing so, and this allows her to earn more income.  Additionally, she is able to take time to be with her young children who are at the age when they need much looking after.  She hopes to be able to continue making her customers happy and providing them with the security of feeling beautiful in themselves, and down the line she would like to have some premises where she can sell further types of products.

This will be her ninth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can take out a loan so that she can meet her objectives.  For her part, she agrees to be punctual with her repayments and so not look bad to the group she belongs to, as everyone there is very responsible and they are all very good people.  

With the requested amount of 2,000 soles, she will purchase more beauty products, cosmetics and perfumes to be able to offer a greater quantity and variety for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 30 years old and lives in Airport Community. She is married with five children, ages 7 to 18 years old, that live at home and attend school. 

For the past 11 years, Mamie has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it keeps her saving everyday. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is a 44 year old mother who has three children. She owns a canteen business, which she has been running for the past 15 years. This business helps so much in solving many of her family's basic needs. In order to continue to provide for the family, she has requested this loan to add more items to the canteen. The items she will purchase are highly demanded by the clients. With the profits, she will pay school fees and build a house as her residence.

loans.use: To buy more items in the canteen.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian, aged 40, is a widow. She has 4 children and all are enrolled in schools. She sells fruits, a business which she has been running for the last 20 years. Marian wants the loan to upgrade her fruit business because she says that has helped her sustain her family's needs. With the profits she wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Thaciene

texts.en:
Thaciene is 42 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have 4 children between the ages of 3 and 13 years. All of the children attend school. 

Thaciene owns a boutique, which she has been running for the past 12 years. She has requested the loan to buy more items to sell in the boutique such as sugar, rice, soaps and lotions. With the profits from the business she wishes to reinvest in the same business, her boutique. She is very hard working and dreams high for the future to have every item sold in the boutique.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, rice and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 45 years old. She lives in Airport community. She stopped her education in the 5th grade. Hawa is married and has 8 children between 11 and 28 years old. She received money from her husband to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business. Her plans is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Augustine B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, this group of teachers will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on these teachers’ behalf.

Augustine is the leader of this group of teachers. The thirty-five-year old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children who are attending primary school. Augustine has been a teacher for three years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, bags of cements, etc. for the future construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 44 years old, lives in Airport community, and is married with two children, ages 15 and 19 years old, that live at home and attend school. For the past year now, Martha has been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She enjoys the flow of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, onion, salt, vita and coal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, onion, salt, vita and coal for her business

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Las Estrellas se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Adelina contactó con la asesora quien le informo de la forma de trabajar de la fundación paraguaya y logró juntar a 12 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo. Ellas están muy entusiasmadas de trabajar con la fundación y su meta es ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Adelina se dedica a la costura, y nos cuenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace ya un buen tiempo, y gracias a esto ha conseguido ya una buena clientela. Se define como una persona que se esfuerza siempre al máximo para dar un buen trabajo a sus clientes, y es por eso que le va muy bien.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, gomas y demás insumos necesarios para poder cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
'Las Estrellas' (Stars) is the name of this group of women which was formed in the city of Itá thanks to its current manager Adelina who contacted a loan officer who, in turn, informed her about how Fundación Paraguaya works.  She managed to get together 12 women who are working very happily together on their first loan cycle.  They are very keen to work with Fundación Paraguaya and their goal is to help each other so that they can make progress.

Adelina's business is sewing and she tells us that she has been in this line of work for a long time.  Thanks to her work, she has already gained a good customer base.  She describes herself as a person who works as hard as she can so that she can provide her customers with a job well done.  For this reason, her business does very well.

Adelina is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, glue and other supplies she needs to fill some of the orders that she has.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, glue, etc.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia es una mujer de 36 años, que tiene 4 hijos de 2,3,4 y 5 años de edad. Su pareja trabaja como albañil. Viven en Santo Domingo que es una ciudad dinámica y acogedora perteneciente a la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" recientemente conformada en el 2007. En esta tierra habitan ciudadanos de todos los rincones del Ecuador, lo que la hace diversa y emprendedora y esa es precisamente su identidad. Se encuentra en una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, teniendo una temperatura promedio de 22,9°C. Por su ubicación geográfica, tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa.

Desde hace 5 años ella vende comida en un puesto ambulante. Trabaja desde la una de la tarde hasta las 6. Su gran obstáculo son las épocas de lluvias, ya que su negocio funciona a la intemperie. Ella quiere invertir en un pequeño horno y un parasol (pequeña carpa) para su negocio. Por este motivo ella ha acudido a Fundación Alternativa, quien será la institución intermediaria entre ella y los prestatarios a nivel mundial, para otorgarle un crédito y con el la oportunidad de que su negocio crezca.

Ella espera mejorar sus ventas con esta inversión y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Senobia is 36 years old and has four children aged 2, 3, 4, and 5. Her husband is a bricklayer. They live in Santo Domingo, a dynamic friendly city in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas which was formed in 2007. The people who live here come from all corners of Ecuador which has given the area a diverse and entrepreneurial character. The subtropical climate is wet with an average temperature of 22.9°C. Because of its geographical location, it has many active businesses and has become the crossroads between the interior and the coast.

For five years Senobia has sold food in the streets. She works from one in the afternoon until six in the evening. Her biggest problem is caused by the rainy season as she works out in the open. She wishes to buy a small oven and an umbrella (or small tent) so she has approached Fundacíon Alternativa--the institution that acts as intermediary between her and donors--for a loan and the opportunity to see her business grow.

Senobia hopes to increase sales and thus her income with this investment so she can provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an oven and umbrella

loans.name: María Soraida

texts.es:
María es una mujer joven de 36 años, que tiene tres hijos, de 10, 17 y 18 años de edad. Juntos viven en Santo Domingo que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador, su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. La provincia a la que pertenece esta ciudad es considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Por enseñanza de su familia, María se dedica a sembrar plátano y para luego venderlo y de esta manera ella da el sustento a su hogar. Ella desea invertir en su sembrío por lo que solicitó un crédito a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que ha ayudado a esta emprendedora. Este no es su primer crédito, y ella siempre ha sido puntual con los pagos. No ha podido asistir a la última capacitación de Fundación Alternativa, pero le gusta la atención que su oficial de crédito le brinda y espera poder capacitarse esta vez.

Trabaja 8 horas al día y sus hijos le ayudan, ella quiere alcanzar su gran sueño que es tener  una casa más grande y que sus hijos se sigan educando.
texts.en:
María is a young woman of 36, who has three children aged 10, 17, and 18.  They live together in Santo Domingo, which is the fourth largest city population-wise in Ecuador.  Its population is growing rapidly, and it has rich commerce and the largest livestock market in the country.  It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America.  The province to which this city belongs is considered new, as it was created in 2007.

To pay for the education of her family, María works growing and selling plantains and in this way she supports her household.  She wants to invest in her farming, which is why she has requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa, which is the financial institution which has helped her to become an entrepreneur.  This is not her first loan, and she has always been punctual with her repayments.  She was not able to attend Fundación Alternativa last training, but she likes the service that her loan official provides and hopes to be able to get trained this time round.

She works eight hours a day and her children help her out.  She wants to achieve her big dream, which is to have a larger home and for her children to continue their education.

loans.use: improve her plantain plantation.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con la esperanza de trabajar juntas y apoyarse las unas a las otras por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, es por ello que su grupo lleva el nombre de "Mujeres Luchadoras", ya que ellas desean un mejor porvenir para sus familias y también para sus hijos.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Ysidora, quien nos comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en su despensa. Cuenta que había empezado con un negocio pequeño, pero que gracias al esfuerzo que le ha puesto ha logrado ir creciendo y de esa forma puede ayudar a su familia. Desea poder seguir agrandando su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella pide ayuda a kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de enlatados, lácteos, bebidas, y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y tener productos en stock para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
13 women from the city of San Lorenzo have united in the hope of working together and supporting each other through their joint work.  They are very hard-working and tenacious people which is why their group is called "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Tenacious Women).  They want a better future for their families and their children.

One of these women is Ysidora, who tells us that she works from very early in the morning every day in her grocery store.  She says that she started out with a small business but, thanks to the hard work that she has put in, she has managed to grow her business and is therefore able to help her family.  She would like to be able to continue expanding her business and be able to continue helping her family.

Ysidora is requesting help from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy canned food, dairy products, drinks and vegetables with which to stock her business.  This way she will have products in stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned food, dairy products, drinks and vegetables

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 63 years old, married, and lives with her grandson.  She prides herself in being a hard-worker who always tries to get herself ahead.  She has been working with cattle since she was 17 and her mom gave her a cow as a gift.  She now has ten cows which she largely takes care of alone.  This is her first time taking out a loan.  She would like to use the money to buy another cow which will increase her earnings and hopefully better her quality of life.  In the near future, she hopes to also be able to purchase other animals such as pigs and sheep in order to further expand her business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 60 years old, married, and describes himself as a man with a positive attitude who likes to learn about everything. He used to be a taxi driver when he bought his first cow at age 30, and has been working with cattle ever since.  He loves working with his cows, as they fill him with joy.  He now owns three cows and has a newborn calf.  With this, his first loan, he plans to buy another cow which would raise his level of income and better his quality of life.  In the future, he hopes to continue to expand his cattle business and to take even better care of his beloved milk cows.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Segunda's Group

texts.en: Segunda is 49 years old, married and the mother of six children who range in age from 11 to 24 years old. For the last 20 years, she has earned a living by raising and selling farm animals. She works with her husband and is applying for this first loan to buy some pigs to raise, something which she hopes will increase her income. In the future, she hopes to earn enough money to buy a plot of land nearby where her children can build their own home. Segunda is standing in front of the group, in the stripped sweater.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is 35 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married with 6 children, ages 6 to 16, that are in school and live at home. Ellen stopped her education in 12th grade. For the past 5 years, she has been in the soap market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Luis Jorge

texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old and lives in Quito.  He is construction worker who describes himself as a patient man who never gives up.  He learned the construction trade from his father when he was just eight years old and has been honing his skills ever since. 

Luis has been doing well but knows that he could do even better if he owned his own construction pallets rather than having to rent them each time.  He is requesting a loan, which he will to use to buy his own pallets in order to save money and build quality foundations.  He wants to use the extra income to help out his family. One day Luis hopes to have a business big enough that it will enable him to provide work for his friends and others.

loans.use: to purchase pallets to build foundations.

loans.name: María Rebeca

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 51 años que vive en Santo Domingo, que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito (Capital del Ecuador).  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del país y es un punto de encuentro de varias ciudades importantes; es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país por lo que tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica, es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical y posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

María es madre de tres hijos pero no tiene esposo. Ella inició la venta de productos naturales en una empresa de multinivel por incentivo de una vecina y hoy se dedica a esta actividad. Ella requiere un crédito que le permita comprar productos y de esta manera ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Además tiene una deuda de 100 USD que quiere pagarla.

Ella espera mejorar sus ingresos con esta inversión, no es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, y María es considerada una excelente cliente por la puntualidad en los pagos.
texts.en:
María is a 51 year old woman who lives in Santo Domingo, which is a canton and city in the new province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was a rural parish of Quito (the capital city of Ecuador).  Santo Domingo lies between the coast and mountains of the country, and is a meeting point for various important cities.  It is the area of the country with the greatest rainfall, which is why it has great hydrological wealth.  It has a subtropical rainy climate and an average temperature of 22 °C.

María is the mother of three children, but she has no husband.  She began selling natural products for a multi-level business at the incentive of a neighbor, and today she is focused on this activity.  She is requesting the loan to allow her to purchase products, and in this way to offer her customers variety.  She also has a small debt of 100 USD, which she wants to pay back.

She hopes to improve her income with this investment.  This is not her first loan with Fundación Alternativa, and María is considered to be an excellent client given her punctuality in repayments.

loans.use: to purchase more products and repay a debt.

loans.name: Bondo

texts.en:
Bondo is 39 years old. He lives in the village of Dologani with his family: wife Gulnazi, 3-year-old daughter, 1-year-old son, and parents. Bondo works as a worker in the village.  At the same time, he is involved in a family agricultural business. They have 0.6 hectare of land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. He sells the harvested fruits and vegetables locally to greengrocery product retailers. The total average monthly income for the family is 1200 Laris, including the pensions of Bondo’s parents.

Bondo requested credit to purchase saplings of nut trees. He will plant them on the family-owned plot and get the first harvest after 2-3 years. The harvested nuts will be sold locally to nut processing factories.  The income of the family will increase and Bondo will be able to provide better care for his children as well as other members of his family.

loans.use: buy nut tree saplings

loans.name: Wilsam

texts.en: Wilsam is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and four children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has requested a loan for 14,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Sopey Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité Sopey Mame Diarra a été créé le 21-12-2009. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles s'exercent pour la plupart dans le commerce et l'embouche.		
Mame Saye debout à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants et à en charge 1 neveu et 1 nièce. 		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter des brebis qu'elle va engraisser et au bout de 5 mois les revendre dans  les marchés hebdomadaires de la localité.		
Ses recettes lui permettront d'aider son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sopey Mame Diarra solidarity group has been created on December 21, 2009. It is composed of 14 women living in the same  village. Their business activities are mostly vending and raising livestock. Mame Saye, standing on the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of nine. She also has one nephew and one niece in her care.

With her loan, she is going to buy sheep for fattening and then reselling five months later at the local markets in her town.
Her revenues will allow her to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Klever Vinicio

texts.es:
Klever  es un joven emprendedor de 27 años, soltero y sin hijos que vive en Santo Domingo, que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el año 2007.

Klever estudió mecánica y hoy en día ejerce su profesión ya que es propietario de un taller de reparación de vehículos. Le faltan algunas herramientas para realizar de mejor manera su trabajo por lo que solicitó su segundo crédito a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que le ha sabido apoyar con recursos no solamente financieros sino con asesoría y servicios no financieros. Klever ha sido un buen cliente y se espera que este crédito al igual que el anterior lo pague puntualmente.

El sueña con tener su propia casa, su auto y como él mismo menciona, tener una "buena familia".
texts.en:
Klever is a young entrepreneur aged 27.  He is single and has no children, and lives in Santo Domingo which is one of the youngest cities in Ecuador and was formed in the connecting point between the mountain and coastal regions of the country.  It is a privileged location, not just because of its ethnic richness, but also for the scenery that you come across.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is currently part of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was founded recently in 2007.

Klever studied mechanics and today he works in this profession as proprietor of a vehicle repair workshop.  He is lacking several tools that he need to do his work in the best way, which is why he has requested his second loan through Fundación Alternativa.  This is the financial institution that he has known to provide support with resources: not just financial ones, but also advice and non-financial services.  Klever has been a good client and hopes to pay back this loan punctually in just the same way as he did the previous one.

His dream is to have his own home and car, and as he also says, to have a "good family".

loans.use: to purchase tools for his vehicle repair workshop.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last 27 years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan lives in the village of Tskhratskaro, West Georgia. He is 58 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Tsisana, 26-year-old son and 26-year-old daughter-in-law. Tsisana works as a cleaner in a local company. Levan is a construction worker. Along with his main job, he is leading the agricultural business for the family. His son helps him. The family has 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Tsisana produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of this product in the nearby town. Also the family has 2 pigs and they sell on average 18 piglets per year.  Along with domestic animals, the family owns 0.8 hectare of land, where various vegetables are grown. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Levan requested credit to purchase a tractor. He will use it to till his own land – it will save the family’s costs on land cultivation. Also he will provide seasonal services to neighbor farms. This will give additional income to the family. They will be able to renovate their house and purchase additional household goods and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy a tractor

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She has a pen where she sells grown and matured pigs. Emma has had this business for 13 years and is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs to eat. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs to eat.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 48 años, es una mujer amable y muy emprendedora, no le teme a los retos. Convive con Tolentino de 52 años con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores y gracias a sus sabios consejos son personas productivas dentro de la sociedad, y solo María su menor hija de 15 años es la única que aun depende de ella para su educación. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde a diario trabajan mucho para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Como todos los días, Lita sale muy temprano de su hogar, va en busca de ingredientes e insumos para así poder preparar los deliciosos platos con los que deleita a diario a sus fieles comensales. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 6 años y durante este tiempo trabaja sola ya que no tiene ayuda alguna de ningún personal. Le esta yendo muy bien, genera buenas ventas diarias y con lo mismo tiene buenos ingresos los cuales utiliza para poder satisfacer las necesidades principales de sus hijos. Tiene muchas metas trazadas, pero por el memento desea ampliar su negocio y empezar a vender desayunos y por las noche algunos platillos. Éste será el crédito número 12 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo una cliente puntual y pagar sus cuotas tal como le programen, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su negocio, además de comprar nuevas mesas y sillas para poder atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lita, aged 48, is a friendly and very enterprising woman who is not afraid of challenges.  She lives with Tolentino, aged 52, with whom she has five children.  Four of them are grown, and thanks to her wise guidance, are productive people in society.  María, her younger daughter aged 15, is the only one who still depends on Lita for her education.  They live together in their own home where they work hard every day to be able to have a better quality of life.

As she does everyday, Lita leaves her home very early in the morning to find the ingredients and supplies to be able to prepare the delicious dishes that delight her faithful diners on a daily basis.   She has been doing this work for six years, and during this time she has been working on her own as she has no help from anybody.  She is doing very well, and generates good sales on a daily basis, with which she earns good income that she uses to be able to meet her children's principal needs.

She has many goals, but for the moment she wants to grow her business and begin to sell breakfast and additional dishes in the evenings.

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will get financial support, as with this she will feel confident in advancing with her work.  For her part, she agrees to continue being a punctual client and to make her repayments as scheduled.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as everyone is very responsible and supportive.

With the requested amount of 3,000 soles, she will purchase ingredients and supplies to continue with her business.  She will also purchase new tables and chairs to be able to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the preparation of food, and also tables and chairs.

loans.name: Hiasmie

texts.en:
Hiasmie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Hiasmie has a shop from which she sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy inventory from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Hiasmie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Hiasmie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Jenilyn has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy inventory of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jenilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jenilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Rolenda

texts.en: Ma. Rolenda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Ma. Rolenda has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Ma. Rolenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ma. Rolenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Tirisita

texts.en: Tirisita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. She has a pen where she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for two years and is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs to eat. Tirisita joined HSPFI last year and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs to eat.

loans.name: Mevlud

texts.en:
Mevlud is a 47-year-old farmer from the village of Boslevi in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Darejan and 4 children (20, 16, 8 and 3 years old). Mevlud is the only income provider in the family. 

The family has a milk cow. Mevlud produces cheese and sells it at the local open market.  Also he runs a small poultry farm. Mevlud purchases chickens, raises them and sells the grown chickens at local open market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 600 Laris. 

Mevlud requested credit to purchase more chickens. He will raise and sell them after two months.  Increasing the amount of chickens on the farm will raise the income for the family. Mevlud plans to reinvest part of the increased income into the same business, and use the rest to finance his family's daily needs.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Janette has a retail shop from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 21,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Janette has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Janette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rosesa

texts.en:
Rosesa is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rosesa has a retail shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosesa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mary Grace has a electronics shop from which she repairs electronic gadgets & appliances. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools for the electronics repair shop.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Melinda has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Garcelis William

texts.es:
Garcelis es un joven de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus 2 hijos, su casa en la que actualmente viven está ubicada en  el  Caserío rural  Pedregal Bajo, Distrito de Tambogrande, distrito que pertenece a la provincia a de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito el cual poco esta progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Su Actividad principal de Garcelis es dedicarse junto a su esposa es a la venta de animales entre ganado, ovino, caprino y animales de corral, actividad que vienen desarrollando desde muy jóvenes, adicionalmente Garcelis se genera ingresos diarios dedicándose solo por la mañanas y recorriendo todos los caseríos aledaños es a la venta de pescado fresco, el cual madruga a comprarlos en los Terminal pesquero mas cercano a su caserío.

Garcelis es un padre de familia muy responsable y es que junto  a su esposa han decido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de alimentos balanceados y en la mejoras de sus corrales donde crían a sus animales y  la compra de más pescado ya que cuenta con demanda aun insatisfecha por no tener la cantidad suficiente para atenderlo a todos.

Garcelis debido a su gran responsabilidad como padre y esposos ha trazado sus metas y objetivos bien claros con los que desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Cuentan con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos quienes a la vez son sus clientes.
texts.en:
Garcelis is a young man of 31, who lives with his wife and two children.  The home where they currently live is located in the rural village of Pedregal Bajo, in the district of Tambogrande.  This district is part of Piura province, which is located about three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.  Garcelis lives in the rural part of this district, which is progressing somewhat, but for now only has basic electrical service.

Garcelis' principal activity is working with his wife selling livestock such as cattle sheep, and goats, and farmyard animals.  They have been working in this activity since they were very young.  Garcelis also earns income on a daily basis by working only in the mornings visiting all the nearby villages to sell fresh fish.  He gets up early to purchase the fish at the fishing depot very near to his village.

Garcelis is a very responsible head of the family, and together with his wife they have decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1,500 new soles.  This will be invested in the purchase of balanced animal feed and to make improvements in the pen where they raise their animals.  It will also be used for the purchase of more fish, as there is still unmet demand as he doesn't have sufficient quantities to supply everyone.

Thanks to his big responsibilities as father and husband, Garcelis has set many goals and very clear objectives with which he wants to improve his family's living conditions.  He has many good references from the neighbors who are also his customers.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed and fish for increased sales, and construction materials for his animals' pens.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn is 24 years old and has been blessed with 4 young kids, living together in Prey Chor district. She and her husband are in the same business, as humble rice cultivators. Agriculture is the sole income for the family. This couple typically generates an average of $5.00 per day from their soil. Presently, Mrs. Yorn has hired some construction workers to repair her existing house. However, she has inadequate funds to buy construction supplies for the repairs. So now she is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase the necessary materials to complete constructing her house. In the future, she aims to expand the farmland, thereby increasing her output and her household income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials to complete constructing her house.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has 1 child.
 
Henry has a shop from which he sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Henry is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Henry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a retail business. Ernesto has been in his business for more 2 years and gets 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ernesto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could improve his living standards and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue, made possible by this loan, to meet his growing family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok, age 32, has been residing in Prey Chor district where she grows rice to generate her income. Besides farming, Thuok has been involved in a materials-recycling business. She always goes through the village with her bicycle to collect and buy recycled materials. Then she sells the items in bulk to its industry for profit. 

Due to the lack of capital for purchasing the materials, Thuok won’t be able to sustain this type of business well. Consequently, she would like to acquire some funds from HKL to keep as capital for the purchasing of recycled materials. With the remaining funds, she will partially fix her house. For her prospects, she hopes to improve her existing businesses and she intends to provide her three children with a further education.

loans.use: to keep as capital for the purchasing of recycled materials.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 45-year-old farmer from the village of Saghvine in West Georgia. She lives with her family: husband Nodar, 15-year-old daughter, 13-year-old son and 80-year-old mother-in-law.  Nodar works as a fitter in a local gas company.  Their children go to school.  Nino is leading the agricultural business for her family, which is an important source of income for the family. 

The family runs a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Nino produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product in local open market. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns 4 sheep and sell lambs in the village.  The family also owns a vineyard with 600 vine-trees. Nodar produces wine and sells it in the same open market. The total average monthly income for the family is 600 Laris, including the pension of Nino’s mother-in-law. 

Nino requested credit to purchase more sheep and to start-up of a beekeeping business. With part of the requested credit, she will purchase 3 beehives with bee colonies.  Nino has experience in beekeeping. She will harvest honey twice in the year and sell it in local open market. The new business initiative, as well as the expansion of the sheep farm, will increase the income for the family.  Nino plans to reinvest part of the increased income into further development of the beekeeping business. Also, they will be able to spend more to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy sheep and beehives

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
Leizl is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Leizl has a shop where she makes & sells snacks, like banana cue & banana cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy supplies of bananas for making snacks.

Leizl is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leizl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas for making snacks.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old. He lives in the village of Rodinauli with his family: wife – Thea, 15-year-old son, 10-year-old daughter and parents.  The children go to school.   

Robert works as a truck driver and provides transportation service to the local population. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family's agricultural business.  They have 2 milk cows. Thea produces cheese and sells on average 35 kg of this product in local market.  The family also owns 1.3 hectares of land, where fruits and vegetables are grown.  The harvested products are sold in local open market.  Along with the abovementioned, the family also owns a greenhouse with an area of 500 sq. meters, which is used for growing greens. The total average monthly income for the family is 600 Laris, including the pensions of Robert’s parents. 

Robert requested credit to purchase fertilizers. He will use them to fertilizing the land in the family farm to get a better quality harvest next year. The family will get better income, which will be used to finance the family's daily needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create a credit line for his business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos quienes son dependientes aun,  para lo que cuentan con una casita ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “Sialupe Baca de Punto 9”  el cual esta ubicado a unos 20 minutos del Distrito de Lambayeque y el mismo a unos 15 de la Ciudad de Chiclayo, el caserío en el que vive es netamente agrícola y ganadero, en vía de desarrollo y lo que cuentan solo por ahora con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Cristina se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado siempre teniendo ya un aproximado de 10 años de experiencia, negocio ya heredado de sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a la compra/venta de animales. Para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, adicionalmente se genera otros ingresos diarios vendiendo chicha de jora, la unión entre sus hijos y su esposo ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Cristina al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar alimentos balanceados los cuales servirán para el engorde de sus animales y los insumos para producir mas chicha de jora. Cristina ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 700 Nuevos Soles los cuales ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos con los que podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez para pagar su crédito solicitado.

Cristina es una mujer emprendedora desde muy pequeña gracias a los valores inculcados por sus padres, valores los cuales ahora son reconocidos por su vecinos quienes le guardan mucha admiración por que siempre esta preocupando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 42-year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and her children who are still dependent on her.  They have a small house in a rural village called "Sialupe Baca de Punto 9" which is located some 20 minutes from Lambayeque district, which is 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  The people in Cristina's village mainly work in farming and livestock raising.  It is a developing area and, right now, the only basic service they have access to is electricity.

Cristina's daily business is raising and selling animals such as cattle, sheep, farmyard birds (ducks and turkeys), guinea pigs, etc.  This is a business that she has always worked in and she has approximately 10 years experience.  She inherited the business from her parents who taught her, from a very early age, how to buy and sell animals.  She has set up spaces on her property where she raises these animals.  In addition, Cristina also makes daily income selling 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink).  Her children and husband work together with her in undertaking new family projects.  They work every day to achieve their goals and thereby improve their living conditions.

Cristina has clear and established goals.  She would like to buy nutritionally-balanced feed which she will use to fatten her animals.  She will also buy ingredients for making more 'chicha de jora'.  Cristina has requested a loan for 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to make more income.  This will enable her to improve her quality of life and also repay her loan.

Cristina has been an entrepreneurial woman since she was very young thanks to the values that her parents instilled in her.  These values are now recognized by her neighbors who have a great deal of admiration for her because she is always looking out for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed and supplies for producing 'chicha de jora'

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a 42-year-old bakery owner.  She is married and lives with her husband and some of her children.  She describes herself as a someone who is easy-going, friendly, and very polite.  

Blanca started baking about 25 years ago when her kids were still very young.  She would use the oven in her house, and buying wheat in small quantities, she was able to produce just enough bread to sell to the neighborhood bakeries.  

With the help of two previous loans, Blanca now owns her own business and would like to use this next credit to buy more and better ingredients to continue to expand her bakery.  Her dream is to make enough to provide stability for herself and her family, and in time, to provide jobs for others as well.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Mrs. Din is 37 years old and married. She cultivates rice to earn a living. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is a construction foreman. Her husband usually goes to work in different places of the country, where people provide him and his team work to do. This couple has been blessed with four single children who presently live under her care in Prey Chor district.

Mrs. Din wants to support her husband’s business by buying necessary construction supplies for him to use. However, she has inadequate capital for that. Thus, she has requested a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a machine that can be used to mix cement, sand, small stone, and water. This loan will improve the business and there will be more customers who want to use his construction services.

loans.use: to purchase a machine that can be used to mix cement

loans.name: Jay Ar

texts.en: Jay Ar is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Jay Ar has a shop that sells electronic products like microphones & remote controls. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy electronics and gadgets to sell in his shop. Jay Ar is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jay Ar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy electronics and gadgets for resale

loans.name: Darwen

texts.en: Darwen is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. Darwen has a shop that sells souvenirs like necklaces and bracelets made out of sea shells. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy materials, such as sea shells, needed for making these souvenirs. Darwen has been a member of HSPFI for since 2009. In the future, Darwen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making souvenirs

loans.name: Yamile

texts.en:
Yamile and her husband moved to the United States from Colombia in hopes of becoming entrepreneurs and controlling their own destiny in a new place. They opened a cell-phone store, VIT Services Corp, DBA VIT Wireless-Metro PCS in South Florida, Florida over three years ago and with its great store-front location in the midst of a very busy strip mall, the business has been able to grow at a steady rate. In addition to being the co-owner of VIT Service Corp, Yamile’s husband is also a part-time faculty member at the University of Miami. 

The store now has three full-time employees and is looking to expand. Yamile hopes to franchise her business to other locations in the future, but for now is focused on creating the best atmosphere in her current location. This loan would be to help purchase new store displays to attract additional clientele.

loans.use: to revamp store displays.

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es:
Lorreine, de 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, está casada con Estanis de 61 años y con quien tiene cuatro hijos a quienes crió y educó, hoy son independientes y personas de bien. Ella vive a lado de su esposo en su casa propia en donde comparten sus días con las ganas de trabajar mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando algún vecino, amigo o familiar necesita comprar alguna prenda de vestir a buen precio, buen diseño y sobre todo muy a la moda, acuden a casa de Lorreine, ya que ahí encuentran los mejores diseños, y marcas en ropa. Por otro lado, su forma de vender lo hace a crédito o al contado, buscando la manera que mas le convenga al cliente. Además posee una chacra y también se dirige ahi y a los pueblos cercanos a ofrecer sus prendas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes y casi nunca le sobran prendas. Eso le ha ayudado aumentar sus ingresos, y más aún porque trabaja en un aserradero de la ciudad. Espera seguir creciendo y montar un local donde pueda exhibir con mayor tranuilidad su mercadería. Este será el crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila, ella por su parte esta comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas así como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más mercadería ya que desea poder brindar mayor opción en cuanto a diseños y calidad.
texts.en:
48-year-old Lorreine is a hard-working and very responsible woman.  She is married to 61-year-old Estanis and the couple have four children who they raised and educated.  Their children are now independent and upstanding citizens.  Lorreine lives alongside her husband in their own home where they share their days and their desire to work hard in order to achieve a better quality of life.  When any of her neighbors, friends or family members need to buy good designs and very fashionable clothes at a good price, they come to Lorreine's house because there they find the best clothing designs and brands.  Lorreine makes her sales on credit or for cash, according to her customers' preference.  In addition, she owns a farm.  She also goes there and to the neighboring villages to offer her clothes for sale.  She has been in this line of work for 2 years and it is doing very well because she has a lot of customers.  She almost never has any clothes left over.  This has helped her to increase her income and she makes further income because she works in a sawmill in the city.  Lorreine hopes to continue growing her business and to set up premises where she can display her merchandise more peacefully.

This will be Lorreine's 10th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will give her a guarantee that she can continue working peacefully.  For her part, Lorreine pledges to continue being punctual in making her loan repayments as she was with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people.  Lorreine will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy more merchandise as she would like to be able to offer her customers more options as regards different designs and quality.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 38-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Heyam sells clothes and she is working from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to to purchase more quantities of clothes for business purposes.

Heyam is looking to provide better living conditions for her family and establish her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Heba is looking to provide better living conditions to her family thus she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to do maintenance for her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 48 años que vive con su esposa Angélica, tienen tres hijos los cuales ya no viven con ellos por ser independientes. Residen desde ya hace muchos años en Santo Domingo, es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito (capital del Ecuador);  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del país y es un punto de encuentro de varias ciudades importantes, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. 

Luis trabaja vendiendo zapatos ambulantemente, este trabajo lo inicio por cuenta propia hace 9 años. Trabaja de miércoles a domingo junto a su esposa, recorriendo las calles de Santo Domingo para vender su mercadería. Luis quiere invertir en mercadería y para ello necesita un crédito con el cual pueda comprar más zapatos y con mayor surtido vender más y tener mayores ingresos.

Luis espera tener una mejor calidad de vida con esta inversión y también estar más cerca de su sueño que es tener su propio local de zapatos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 48-year-old man who lives with his wife Angélica.  They have three children who no longer live with them because they live independently.  They have lived for many years in Santo Domingo, a canton and city in the new province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas which used to be a rural parish of Quito (the capital of Ecuador).  Santo Domingo is located between the country's coastline and mountains.  It is a meeting point for several important cities.  It receives more rainfall than anywhere else in the country.

Luis' business is selling shoes as an itinerant vendor.  He set himself up in his own business 9 years ago.  He works from Wednesday to Sunday, together with his wife.  They travel through the streets of Santo Domingo selling their merchandise.  Luis would like to invest in merchandise and needs a loan so that he can buy more shoes.  With more stock available he will sell more and make more income.

Luis hopes to enjoy a better quality of life as a result of this investment and hopes to be closer to his dream of owning his own shoe store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Sop Serigne Moustapha F. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Moustapha F. est créé depuis le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de  sept femmes qui sont parentes, amies et voisines.La principale activité est le commerce.

Ndéye Fatou la responsable est mariée, elle est âgée de 39 ans et mère de trois enfants. Elle fait du commerce de tissus teintés (thioub) dont la vente est plus accentuée pendant les périodes de fêtes religieuses (tabaski). Elle exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans. Elle est à debout à droite habillée en noir beige avec un foulard autour de la tête.
Elle achéte ses thioub dans une ville voisine quant aux moutons elle se les procure dans sa ville même et revend sur place.
Elle compte avec son prêt faire de l'embouche et du commerce pour se faire beaucoup de gains.

Elle soutient ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins et souhaite plus tard gérer ses propres affaires.
texts.en:
The Sop Sereigne Moustapha F. solidarity group was set up on 27 December 2010. It is made up of seven women who are relatives, friends and neighbours. Trade is their main activity. 

Ndéye Fatou is the head of the group. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She trades dyed cloth (known as thioub), which sells particularly well during religious festivals, such as Tabaski. She has been in this business for 13 years, and is pictured on the right dressed in black and beige and wearing a headscarf.

She buys her thioub in a neighbouring town and purchases the sheep in her own town, where she then resells them. With her loan she hopes to fatten the sheep and make a profit through trading her goods.

Ndéye Fatou provides for her children's various needs and in the future would like to manage her own business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Baqa’a, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Salam benefited from a training course she took previously  in decorating with flowers. She established her home-based business in the same field that provided her with a modest income.

Salam is requesting  a loan of 600 JD to purchase materials needed in her business and is looking to open a shop for flower arrangements, embroidery and ceramics so that she can increase her income and purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for flower arrangements.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 52 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines. She has a shop that sells snacks such as cheese and pan cakes. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Azucena is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Azucena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
